                    <div id="main-content" class="wiki-content group">
                    <div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable"><colgroup><col/><col/><col/><col/><col/><col/><col/><col/></colgroup><tbody><tr><th colspan="1" class="confluenceTh">Sequence</th><th class="confluenceTh">Product Release</th><th class="confluenceTh">Project</th><th class="confluenceTh">Major Features</th><th colspan="1" class="confluenceTh">Dependencies</th><th colspan="1" class="confluenceTh">Ready for Field Trial</th><th class="confluenceTh">Product Release Date</th><th colspan="1" class="confluenceTh">Comments</th></tr><tr><td colspan="1" style="text-align: center;" class="confluenceTd"><strong>1</strong></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><p>OP Pro 3.0-003</p></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">9106 Screen Replacements</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><p><strong>Stable version incorporating 3.1 and ERG patches</strong></p><ul><li>MASEP v3.3.2</li><li>V1000 Display support</li></ul></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">MASEP v3.3.2</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">N/A</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">14-Nov-22</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><p>OP Pro Truck &amp; Shovel LP web panels only supported on V1000 Display.  Slight change to installers to decouple chromium from MASEP image and force start OP Pro web panel.</p><p>Support for MASEP 3.3.2 Brightness &amp; Volume API</p><p>V1000 300 units available Nov-2022.</p></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" style="text-align: center;" class="confluenceTd"><strong>2</strong></td><td class="confluenceTd">OP Pro 3.1-001</td><td class="confluenceTd">8810 Onboard Shell App</td><td class="confluenceTd"><ul><li><strong>Onboard Shell App 1.0</strong></li><li><strong>OP Pro Plugin 1.0</strong></li><li>Reverse Assist Plugin 1.0</li><li>Diagnostic Plugin 1.0</li><li>Platform 2.26.3</li><li>GVOS 6.2-022</li><li>OP Pro Truck LP + Reverse Assist integration</li></ul></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">1-Aug-22</td><td class="confluenceTd">18-Oct-22</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" style="text-align: center;" class="confluenceTd"><strong>3</strong></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>OP Pro 2.8-005</p><p>OP Pro 3.0-003</p><p>OP Pro 3.1-002</p></td><td class="confluenceTd">9106 Screen Replacements</td><td class="confluenceTd"><ul><li><strong>Ruby 64 bit panels support</strong></li><li>X900 &amp; MP1225 Display support</li><li>X900 OP Pro 2.8, 3.0, 3.1 back compatibility</li><li>Shell App 32 bit</li><li>MASEP v3.3.2</li><li>GVOS 6.2-022 (3.0 + 3.1)</li></ul><p><br/></p></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><p>OP Pro Ruby GTK3 LP &amp; HP panels developed by Jon Olson</p><p>MineOperate Product Engineer for field trial</p></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><p>14-Nov-22</p><p><br/></p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>12-Dec-22</p><p><br/></p></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><p>X900 300 units available Nov-2022</p></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" style="text-align: center;" class="confluenceTd"><strong>4</strong></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">OP Pro 4.0-000</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">9106 Screen Replacements </td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><p>OP Pro 64 bit release</p><ul><li><strong>Shell App + OP Pro plugin (64-bit)</strong></li><li><strong>Ruby LP &amp; HP 64 bit panels</strong></li><li>MASEP v3.3.2</li><li>X900 &amp; MP1225 Display support</li><li>GVOS 6.2.x</li></ul></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Shell App + OP Pro plugin 64-bit builds<br/>(to be completed by Vikings team)</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">14-Nov-22</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">12-Dec-22</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Truck &amp; Shovel LP web panels on Shell App only</td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" style="text-align: center;" class="confluenceTd"><strong>5</strong></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>OP Pro 4.1-000 RC1</p><p>OP Lite 1.0</p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>8754 Task Management 1.0</p><p>9875 OP Lite </p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>OP Lite Release Candidate</p><p><strong>OP Pro Aux LP web panels (Dozer, Grader, Water Truck)</strong></p><p>Unattended Mode</p><ul><li>X900 &amp; MP1225 Display support</li><li>Smart Antenna Support</li><li>MASEP v3.3.3</li><li>Shell App + OP Pro plugin 64 bit</li><li>GVOS 6.2.x</li></ul></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><p>MASEP 3.3.3 support (Smart Antenna &amp; P2P)</p><p>Smart Antenna field validation complete</p><p>MineOperate Product Engineer for field trial</p></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">12-Dec-22</td><td class="confluenceTd">1-Feb-23</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Objective 4.1-000 RC1 ready for field trial at end of PI-4</td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" style="text-align: center;" class="confluenceTd"><strong>6</strong></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">OP Pro 4.2-000 RC1</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Project Leap (Objectives 1 &amp; 2)</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><p><span>Technical validation of converged OAS+OP Pro converged architecture. No SA support.</span></p><ul><li>Shell App 64 bit (Truck &amp; Shovel LP)</li><li><strong>GVOS 8.x</strong></li><li><strong>OpenWRT on Core LP 256</strong></li><li>Ruby LP/HP panels 64 bit</li><li>MASEP 3.3.2 (Displays)</li><li>OAS running on Core.  Replacement of Guardvant box.</li></ul></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Q4 &amp; Q1</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">1-Apr-23</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><p>OAS+OP Pro onboard and back end convergence has high impact &amp; <span class="inline-comment-marker" data-ref="aa14f305-cfa4-4c46-901a-4f37752c5628">high risk</span>.  Entire solution impacted not only Trucks running OAS which is the scope for LEAP.</p><p>OAS &amp; OP Pro operating modes</p><p>Converged database schema</p><p><span class="inline-comment-marker" data-ref="e3c2f653-7947-42c0-b4ac-6d7eb6c85625">Docker containers</span></p></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" style="text-align: center;" class="confluenceTd"><strong>7</strong></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">OP Pro 4.2-001 RC1</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Project Leap (Objectives 3 &amp; 4)</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><p><span>OAS + OP Pro Commercial product</span></p><ul><li><span>Shell App 64 bit (Truck &amp; Shovel LP)</span></li><li><span>GVOS 8.x</span></li><li><span>Ruby LP/HP panels 64 bit</span></li><li><strong>MDM 1.0</strong></li><li><strong>MASEP 3.3.3 (Smart Antenna/P2P)</strong></li></ul></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Q3</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" style="text-align: center;" class="confluenceTd"><strong>8</strong></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><p>OP Pro 4.3-000 RC1</p><p>Fleet Analytics 2.0</p></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">8569 OP Fleet Analytics</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><ul><li>GVOS 8.x Web API/OP Pro MCT API wrapper</li><li>Fleet Analytics 2.0</li><li>Power BI data model</li><li>OP Pro Web API</li></ul></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">TBC</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">2023 Q2</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">GVOS 8.x release candidate required for field trial</td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" style="text-align: center;" class="confluenceTd"><strong>9</strong></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Task Management 1.0</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">8754 Task Management 1.0</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><ul><li>TM Microservice</li><li>GVOS 8.x Web API/OP Pro MCT API wrapper</li><li>TM Onboard plugin</li><li>TM Office Web App</li></ul></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">OP Pro 4.1 (GVOS 6.x Web API)</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">1-Mar-23</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">1-Apr-23</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">GVOS 8.x release candidate required for field trial</td></tr></tbody></table></div>

                    <h1 id="title-heading" class="pagetitle">
                                                <span id="title-text">
                            Product: MineOperate OP Pro : Shovel LP &amp; Truck LP Panels - Features Completed
                        </span>
                    </h1>
                </div>

                <div id="content" class="view">
                    <div class="page-metadata">
                        
        
    
    
        
    
        
        
            Created by <span class='author'> GEORGE Nathan</span>, last modified on jun 26, 2023
                        </div>
                    <div id="main-content" class="wiki-content group">
                    <div class="table-wrap"><table class="relative-table wrapped confluenceTable"><colgroup><col style="width: 7.33708%;"/><col style="width: 11.7731%;"/><col style="width: class="confluenceTd">OP Pro 3.0-002</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">All</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr><tr><td currently supported on the legacy panel.</p></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Required</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="status-macro                             Product: MineOperate OP Pro : 4.0-001 OP Pro Plugin | Unattended Mode UAT

                    <div id="main-content" class="wiki-content group">
                    <h2 id="id-4.0001OPProPlugin|UnattendedModeUAT-Overview">Overview</h2><p>Validating Unattended Mode on shell-app/oppro-plugin</p><h2 id="id-4.0001OPProPlugin|UnattendedModeUAT-ValidationTest">Validation Test</h2><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable"><colgroup><col/><col/></colgroup><tbody><tr><th scope="row" class="confluenceTh">Date</th><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><time datetime="2024-02-19" class="date-past">19 feb 2024</time></p></div></td></tr><tr><th scope="row" class="confluenceTh"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><strong>Software Versions:</strong></p></div></th><td class="confluenceTd"><p>app-osa-diagnostics-plugin_noarch_1.9.9-master.b97.sqfs, app-osa-oppro-plugin_noarch_4.1.0.sqfs, app-shell-app_x86-64_1.2.0.sqfs</p></td></tr><tr><th scope="row" class="confluenceTh"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><strong>Hardware/Platform Version</strong></p></div></th><td class="confluenceTd"><p><strong>Display: D9S2-A (Display9), D9S2-B (X900), <span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);">D9S6-A (DisplayX)</span></strong></p><ul><li><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak">MASEP Platform 3.3.20, 3.4.8</span></span></li><li>app-osa-diagnostics-plugin_noarch_1.9.9-master.b97.sqfs</li><li>app-osa-oppro-plugin_noarch_4.1.0.sqfs</li><li>app-shell-app_x86-64_1.2.0.sqfs</li></ul><p><strong>Core CoreLP-WWGB</strong></p><ul><li>Platform 2.26.6 (b1387), Platform 2.26.9</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table></div><p><br/></p><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable" data-snooker-col-series="numbers" data-snooker-locked-cols="0"><colgroup><col/><col/><col/><col/><col/><col/></colgroup><tbody><tr><th class="numberingColumn confluenceTh" contenteditable="false" data-mce-resize="false" scope="col"><br/></th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Validation Item</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Status</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Status Update</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Test Result</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Expected Result</th></tr><tr><td class="numberingColumn confluenceTd" contenteditable="false" data-mce-resize="false">1</td><td class="confluenceTd">Map Rendering</td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="status-macro aui-lozenge aui-lozenge-error">FAILED</span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><time datetime="2025-04-07" class="date-past">7 abr 2025</time><a class="confluence-userlink user-mention" data-username="GENA" href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/~GENA" data-linked-resource-id="202706461" data-linked-resource-version="2" data-linked-resource-type="userinfo" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com">GEORGE Nathan</a> appears to be fixed in 4.0.3. OSA v1.2.9 &amp; OPPP v4.1.2</p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak">Objects on lower portion of map are not being rendered properly, seems related with unintentional vertical offset when notification message showing</span></span></p><p><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak"><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" height="250" src="attachments/331681165/331681386.png" data-image-src="attachments/331681165/331681386.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="331681386" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="image-2024-2-19_16-34-54.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="331681165" data-linked-resource-container-version="16" alt=""></span></span></span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd">The map objects should be drawn properly inside visible map area, and not cropped</td></tr><tr><td class="numberingColumn confluenceTd" contenteditable="false" data-mce-resize="false">2</td><td class="confluenceTd">Unattended Mode Activation</td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="status-macro aui-lozenge aui-lozenge-error">FAILED</span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><br/></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Equipment Panel automatically restarted when Unattended Mode global configuration changes on server.</p><p>On test bench where we have <strong>Grader </strong>running shell-app/oppro-plugin, it is also being restarted</p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Equipment Panel automatically restarted when Unattended Mode global configuration changes on server.</p><p>Equipment panel affected is only <strong>Truck </strong>and <strong>Shovel</strong>.</p></td></tr><tr><td class="numberingColumn confluenceTd" contenteditable="false" data-mce-resize="false">3</td><td class="confluenceTd">Unattended Mode Activation</td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="status-macro aui-lozenge aui-lozenge-error">FAILED</span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><br/></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>After unattended mode configuration changed on server, the notification to operator is showing as <span style="color: rgb(255,0,0);">ERROR CODE</span> which may mislead the operator</p><p><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" height="250" src="attachments/331681165/331681388.png" data-image-src="attachments/331681165/331681388.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="331681388" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-container-id="331681165" data-linked-resource-container-version="16" alt=""></span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>After unattended mode configuration changed on server, the notification to operator treated as an Informational types of message not to confuse it with actual error.</p></td></tr><tr><td class="numberingColumn confluenceTd" contenteditable="false" data-mce-resize="false">4</td><td class="confluenceTd"><p><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak">Shovel/Truck - Selecting Assignment Type</span></span></p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="status-macro aui-lozenge aui-lozenge-error">FAILED</span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak"> </span></span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak">First time opening the Unattended Mode view after onboard app started, the list selection is empty</span></span></p><p><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak"><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" height="250" src="attachments/331681165/331681393.png" populated and visible for user to choose</span></span></td></tr><tr><td class="numberingColumn confluenceTd" contenteditable="false" data-mce-resize="false">5</td><td class="confluenceTd"><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak">Shovel/Truck - Selecting Assignment Type</span></span></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="status-macro aui-lozenge aui-lozenge-error">FAILED</span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak"> </span></span></p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak">The visible list is always from the top of the list by default.</span></span></p><p><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak">(i.e: Operator won't be able to know what is the current Blast from Panel directly)</span></span></p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak">When the list is opened, the currently active item (i.e: </span></span><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak">Current Blast Location / Lock) should be pre-selected and visible for operator</span></span></p></td></tr><tr><td class="numberingColumn confluenceTd" aui-lozenge-error">FAILED</span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak"> </span></span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak"><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img data-linked-resource-id="331681978" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="image-2024-2-20_17-25-19.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="331681165" data-linked-resource-container-version="16" alt=""></span></span></span></p><p><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak">How to reproduce:</span></span></p><ol><li><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak">Truck is loading to Shovel</span></span></li><li><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak">Shovel operator change to different Grade by clicking on Material widget and then SET GRADE, or from selecting grade layer and then SET GRADE</span></span></li><li><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak">When Shovel is finished Loading and goes to Waiting, the message will be shown.</span></span></li></ol><p><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak"><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" height="250" src="attachments/331681165/331681991.gif" selection/message should be referring as SYSTEM-DEFINED as per UI Specs.</span></span></td></tr><tr><td class="numberingColumn confluenceTd" contenteditable="false" data-mce-resize="false">8</td><td t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak">There was a change made in 4.0-0001: <a class="external-link" href="https://jira.hexagonmining.com/browse/MOPS-27139" rel="nofollow" panel</span></span></span></p><p><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak"><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p equipment, as it is dependent on customer having specific OEM interface available.</span></span></span></td></tr><tr><td class="numberingColumn confluenceTd" contenteditable="false" position</span></span></span></td></tr><tr><td class="numberingColumn confluenceTd" contenteditable="false" data-mce-resize="false">10</td><td class="confluenceTd">UI Panel (Engine Hours)</td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="status-macro aui-lozenge aui-lozenge-error">FAILED</span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><br/></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Engine Hours value's vertical position is not inline with the label</p><p><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak"><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak"><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" height="250" src="attachments/331681165/331685480.png" data-image-src="attachments/331681165/331685480.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="331685480" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" the configuration '</span></span></span>disable_hourmeter_sensor', or it was set to false</p><div class="code panel pdl" style="border-width: 1px;"><div class="codeContent panelContent pdl">
<pre class="syntaxhighlighter-pre" data-syntaxhighlighter-params="brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence" data-theme="Confluence">disable_hourmeter_sensor=false</pre>
</div></div></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak"><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak"> </span></span></span></td></tr><tr><td class="numberingColumn confluenceTd" contenteditable="false" data-mce-resize="false">11</td><td class="confluenceTd">UI Panel (Engine Hours)</td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="status-macro aui-lozenge aui-lozenge-error">FAILED</span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><br/></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>It is not possible to put engine hours value manually, maybe because the cursor is not visible, so always ended up failed the validation.</p></div><p><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" height="250" src="attachments/331681165/331685571.gif" data-image-src="attachments/331681165/331685571.gif" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="331685571" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="EngineHoursValidationAlwaysFailed.gif" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/gif" data-linked-resource-container-id="331681165" data-linked-resource-container-version="16" alt=""></span></p><p>It was observed with the following configuration:</p><div class="code panel pdl" style="border-width: 1px;"><div class="codeContent panelContent pdl">
<pre class="syntaxhighlighter-pre" data-syntaxhighlighter-params="brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence" data-theme="Confluence">validate_hourmeter_with_range=true
disable_hourmeter_sensor=true</pre>
</div></div><p><br/></p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak"><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak">Operator can enter Engine Hours value manually when configuration put in place.</span></span></span></td></tr><tr><td have proportional size</span></span></span></td></tr><tr><td class="numberingColumn confluenceTd" contenteditable="false" data-mce-resize="false">13</td><td class="confluenceTd">UI Panel (Refuel view)</td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="status-macro aui-lozenge aui-lozenge-error">FAILED</span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><br/></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>On the Refuel view, <span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);">it seems the Apply button is always enabled irrespective of values entered in the Fuel Amount and Engine Hours fields.</span></p><p><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);"><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper t u v w x y z ab ac ae af ag ah ai aj ak"><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);">According to <a class="external-link" rgb(23,43,77);">, the Apply button only gets enabled when we enter the values in both the fields.</span></span></span></span></p><p><span><span class="ui-provider a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s contenteditable="false" data-mce-resize="false">14</td><td class="confluenceTd">Unattended Mode for Truck: Single Assignment</td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="status-macro aui-lozenge aui-lozenge-error">FAILED</span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><br/></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Raised from Tech Pub team during the validation on bench, we only have the <strong>Single Assignment to Shovel</strong>, which only showing list of Shovel:</p><p><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" height="250" src="attachments/331681165/340060677.png" data-image-src="attachments/331681165/340060677.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="340060677" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" Unattended Mode for Truck has the <strong>Single Assignment </strong>menu, in which the list is dynamic based on current truck activity (either loaded or not loaded):</p><p><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" height="250" src="attachments/331681165/340060673.png" data-image-src="attachments/331681165/340060673.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="340060673" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" height="250" src="attachments/331681165/340060675.png" data-image-src="attachments/331681165/340060675.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" alt=""></span></p><p>Refer to <a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=250352040">OP Pro Unattended Mode UI/UX Design</a>, on the topic <strong>4. Creating Single Assignment .. page 6-7</strong></p></div></td></tr><tr><td class="numberingColumn confluenceTd" contenteditable="false" data-mce-resize="false">15</td><td class="confluenceTd">Unattended Mode Activation</td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="status-macro aui-lozenge aui-lozenge-error">FAILED</span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><br/></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>When unattended mode changed (i.e: from disable to enable, or vv), any status change from equipment that require dispatcher approval (auto_accept=false) should get overrides (no longer showing in Dispatcher's Inbox) <strong><span style="color: rgb(255,0,0);">only if JAMS on equipment is restarted manually</span></strong></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>When unattended mode changed (i.e: from disable to enable, or vv), any status change from equipment that require dispatcher approval (auto_accept=false) should get overrides (no longer showing in Dispatcher's Inbox) </p></div></td></tr></tbody></table></div><h2 id="id-4.0001OPProPlugin|UnattendedModeUAT-OtherValidation">Other Validation</h2><div class="table-wrap"><table class="relative-table wrapped confluenceTable" data-snooker-col-series="numbers" data-snooker-locked-cols="0" style="width: 54.0318%;"><colgroup><col style="width: 2.94715%;"/><col style="width: 12.3984%;"/><col style="width: 11.0772%;"/><col style="width: 73.5772%;"/></colgroup><tbody><tr><th class="numberingColumn confluenceTh" contenteditable="false" data-mce-resize="false" scope="col"><br/></th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Validation Item</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Status</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Test Result</th></tr><tr><td class="numberingColumn confluenceTd" contenteditable="false" data-mce-resize="false">1</td><td class="confluenceTd">Drill Ruby Panel</td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="status-macro aui-lozenge aui-lozenge-error">FAILED</span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>The <a class="external-link" href="http://abri-hydra.lgs-net.com:81/Releases/4.0/Products/000/common-x86/sqfs_display/app-ruby-gtk2-x86_64-2.0-2.rc3.sqfs" rel="nofollow">app-ruby-gtk2-x86_64-2.0-2.rc3.sqfs</a> supplied from the 4.0-001 release is exhibiting a known issue in <a class="external-link" href="https://jira.hexagonmining.com/browse/IN-5586" rel="nofollow" style="text-decoration: underline;">IN-5586</a></p><p>(Ruby Panel crash when loading drill pattern, due to missing <strong>leicamath.so</strong>)</p></td></tr><tr><td class="numberingColumn confluenceTd" contenteditable="false" data-mce-resize="false">2</td><td class="confluenceTd">ShellApp</td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="status-macro aui-lozenge aui-lozenge-error">FAILED</span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>The <a class="external-link" href="http://abri-hydra.lgs-net.com:81/Releases/4.0/Products/001/corelp-x86/sqfs_display/app-shell-app_aarch64_1.2.0.sqfs" rel="nofollow">app-shell-app_aarch64_1.2.0.sqfs</a> supplied from the 4.0-001 release is not compatible with V1000 screen.</p><p>App would failed to start with <span style="color: rgb(255,0,0);"><em>error while loading shared libraries: libgbm.so.1</em></span></p></td></tr></tbody></table></div><h2 id="id-4.0001OPProPlugin|UnattendedModeUAT-Relatedarticles">Related articles</h2><p></p><p>

            Created by <span class='author'> GEORGE Nathan</span>, last modified by <span class='editor'> HOLDEN Anthony</span> on mar 27, 2024
                        </div>
                    <div id="main-content" class="wiki-content group">
                    <h2 id="OPProPlugin|AuxLPpanelUAT-Overview">Overview</h2><p><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);">Validating Aux LP equipment panels on shell-app/oppro-plugin</span></p><h2 id="OPProPlugin|AuxLPpanelUAT-Scope"><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);">Scope</span></h2><ul><li><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);">Water Truck LP</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);">Fuel Truck LP</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);">Grader LP</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);">Dozer LP</span></li></ul><h2 id="OPProPlugin|AuxLPpanelUAT-UAT&amp;ValidationTests"><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);">UAT &amp; Validation Tests</span></h2><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable"><colgroup><col/><col/></colgroup><tbody><tr><th scope="row" class="confluenceTh">Date</th><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr><tr><th scope="row" class="confluenceTh">Software Versions</th><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr></tbody></table></div><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable"><colgroup><col/><col/><col/><col/><col/></colgroup><tbody><tr><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Issue#</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Validation Item</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Status</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Test Result</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Expected Result</th></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="status-macro aui-lozenge aui-lozenge-error">FAILED</span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr></tbody></table></div><hr/><p>Testing page props report:</p><p><div class="table-wrap"><table class="aui metadata-summary-macro null" data-cql="label = &quot;oppro&quot; and label = &quot;plugin&quot; and label = &quot;uat&quot; and space = currentSpace()" data-details-id="uat_issue"  data-details-space-key="OPPRO"  data-details-content-id="334113045"  data-headings="Issue#,Validation Item, Status, Test Result, Expected Result" data-first-column-heading="UAT" data-count-comments="false" data-count-likes="false" data-total-pages="0" data-page-size="1000" data-sort-by="null" data-reverse-sort="false" data-blueprint-present="false"><thead><tr><th class="sorter-text">UAT</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td colspan="1">No se ha encontrado contenido.</td></tr></tbody></table></div></p><p><br/></p>

        <div id="page">

                    <h1 id="title-heading" class="pagetitle">
                                                <span id="title-text">
                            Product: MineOperate OP Pro : OP Fleet Lite: Generic Database
                        </span>
                    </h1>
                </div>

                <div id="content" class="view">
                    <div class="page-metadata">
                        
        
    
    
        
    
        
        
            Created by <span class='author'> SHE KHUN Oey</span>, last modified on jul 22, 2025
                        </div>
                    <div id="main-content" class="wiki-content group">
                    <h1 id="OPFleetLite:GenericDatabase-Overview">Overview</h1><p>Information for generic database for OP Fleet Lite test server.</p><h1 id="OPFleetLite:GenericDatabase-ServerInformation">Server Information</h1><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable"><colgroup><col/><col/></colgroup><tbody><tr><th scope="row" class="confluenceTh">Server Name</th><td class="confluenceTd">MINFMSSRV01</td></tr><tr><th scope="row" class="confluenceTh">Address</th><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Public: 20.83.213.92</p><p>Internal Azure Network: 10.0.1.13</p></td></tr><tr><th scope="row" class="confluenceTh">Azure Network Settings</th><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image confluence-thumbnail" draggable="false" height="250" class="confluence-embedded-image confluence-thumbnail" draggable="false" height="250" src="attachments/368469028/368470398.png" data-image-src="attachments/368469028/368470398.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="368470398" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" id="OPFleetLite:GenericDatabase-DatabaseInformation">Database Information</h1><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable"><colgroup><col/><col/><col/><col/><col/></colgroup><tbody><tr><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh"><br/></th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Lite</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Basic</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Advanced</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Premium</th></tr><tr><th scope="row" class="confluenceTh">Database Name</th><td class="confluenceTd">jmineops_lite</td><td class="confluenceTd">jmineops_basic</td><td class="confluenceTd">jmineops_advanced</td><td class="confluenceTd">jmineops_premium</td></tr><tr><th scope="row" class="confluenceTh">File</th><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr></tbody></table></div><p><br/></p><h1 id="OPFleetLite:GenericDatabase-FieldNetworkInformation">Field Network Information</h1><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped relative-table confluenceTable" style="width: 12.9238%;"><colgroup><col style="width: 44.8164%;"/><col style="width: 55.6156%;"/></colgroup><tbody><tr><th scope="row" class="confluenceTh">Interface</th><td class="confluenceTd">tun0</td></tr><tr><th scope="row" class="confluenceTh">Server Address</th><td class="confluenceTd">192.168.11.1</td></tr><tr><th scope="row" class="confluenceTh">Equipment Address Pool</th><td class="confluenceTd">192.168.11.4-192.168.11.253</td></tr><tr><th scope="row" class="confluenceTh">SSID</th><td class="confluenceTd">HxGN-Guest</td></tr><tr><th scope="row" class="confluenceTh">OpenVPN</th><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><h3 id="OPFleetLite:GenericDatabase-Server">Server</h3><p>/opt/Jigsaw/Services/openvpn/openvpn.conf</p><div class="code panel pdl" style="border-width: 1px;"><div class="codeContent panelContent pdl">
<pre class="syntaxhighlighter-pre" data-syntaxhighlighter-params="brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence" data-theme="Confluence">cd &quot;/opt/Jigsaw/Clients/client/openvpn&quot;
local 10.0.1.13
port 1194
proto tcp
server 192.168.11.0 255.255.255.0</pre>
</div></div><h3 id="OPFleetLite:GenericDatabase-Equipment">Equipment</h3><p>/opt/Jigsaw/Clients/lite/openvpn/vpnserver.conf</p><div class="code panel pdl" style="border-width: 1px;"><div class="codeContent panelContent pdl">
<pre class="syntaxhighlighter-pre" data-syntaxhighlighter-params="brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence" data-theme="Confluence">CAHOST=192.168.200.1

VPN_GATEWAY=192.168.11.1

WL_NETMASK=255.255.255.0
WL_GATEWAY=192.168.10.1
WL_BROADCAST=192.168.10.255
WL_WEPKEY=off

</div></div><p><br/></p></div></td></tr></tbody></table></div><h1 id="OPFleetLite:GenericDatabase-Scope">Scope</h1><p>Refer to <a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/1LPS/Scope+-+Outdated%2C+refer+to+Feature+Matrix">Scope - Outdated, refer to Feature Matrix</a>:</p><ul style="list-style-type: square;"><li>Ensuring system able to run <strong>Lite</strong> section, appropriate configs is <span style="color: rgb(0,0,255);">enabled</span>.</li><li>Other functionality in <strong>Basic, Advanced, Premium </strong>is being <span style="color: rgb(255,0,0);">disabled/removed</span> from the system.</li></ul><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable"><colgroup><col/><col/><col/></colgroup><tbody><tr><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Feature Set</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Functionalities</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Remarks</th></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">Core Features</td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Equipment Positioning Tracking<br/>Equipment Time Allocation<br/>Equipment Activity Tracking<br/>Equipment Hours - manual<br/>Operator Login</p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">Load &amp; Haul Fleet</td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Material Tracking<br/>Operator Assignments (Unattended)<br/>Activity cycles via GNSS, Geofences<br/>Offline Data Capture<br/>Shovel &amp; Truck real-time messaging</p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">Drill Fleet</td><td class="confluenceTd">Drill Design Pattern Management<br/>Drill Hole Production Tracking</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">Aux Fleet</td><td class="confluenceTd">Fuel Truck - Fuel Burn Rate</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr></tbody></table></div><p><br/></p><p>Onboard Hardware:</p><ul style="list-style-type: square;"><li>In support: SmartScreen+Core (for initial testing), QD1500+SmartAntenna (official support)</li><li>Remove: Old legacy hardware traces (UHP, MOJO, etc) - configs, devices</li></ul><p>Interface</p><ul style="list-style-type: square;"><li>Remove ALL OEM Interface traces (config, devices)</li></ul><h1 id="OPFleetLite:GenericDatabase-Milestones/Tasks">Milestones / Tasks</h1><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped relative-table confluenceTable" style="width: 91.107%;"><colgroup><col style="width: 17.6216%;"/><col style="width: 4.30295%;"/><col style="width: 76.0871%;"/><col style="width: 1.98072%;"/></colgroup><tbody><tr><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">VM Server Hosting</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Status</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Notes</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh"><br/></th></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Operating System Configs</p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><br/></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper">/etc/timezone</div><div class="content-wrapper">/etc/localtime</div><div class="content-wrapper">/etc/hostname</div><div class="content-wrapper">/etc/hosts</div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Preparing database</p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><br/></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><div id="expander-595482834" class="expand-container"><div role="heading" aria-level="6" id="expander-control-595482834" class="expand-control"><button type="button" id="expand-button-595482834" class="aui-button aui-button-link aui-button-link-icon-text" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="expander-content-595482834" ><span class="expand-icon aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-chevron-down" aria-hidden="true"></span><span class="expand-control-text conf-macro-render">Haz clic aquí para ampliar...</span></button></div><div role="region" id="expander-content-595482834" class="expand-content" aria-labelledby="expand-button-595482834"><div class="code panel pdl" style="border-width: 1px;"><div class="codeContent panelContent pdl">
<pre class="syntaxhighlighter-pre" data-syntaxhighlighter-params="brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence" data-theme="Confluence">cd ~/siteData
tar xvf jmineops_lite_4.0-000.tar.gz
sudo systemctl stop JAMSCluster.service

createdb -U developer -O developer jmineops_lite
psql -U postgres jmineops_lite -c &quot;alter user developer with superuser;&quot;
psql -U postgres jmineops_lite -c &quot;update pg_language set lanpltrusted=true where lanname=&#39;c&#39;;&quot;
psql -U postgres jmineops_lite -c &quot;grant usage on language c to developer;&quot;
psql -U postgres jmineops_lite -c &quot;create extension psqlprocs;&quot;

/opt/Jigsaw/Tools/sql_load jmineops_lite.sqld/ postgres://localhost/jmineops_lite,username=developer,password=GENERIC_PASSWORD
cd /opt/Jigsaw/Library/jmineops/db/migrate
export RAILS_ENV=&#39;lite&#39;
rake migrate
/opt/Jigsaw/Tools/xml_loader -database jmineops_lite views</pre>
</div></div><p><br/></p></div></div></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Configuration Files</p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><br/></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><strong>Notable file changes for &quot;Lite&quot; version</strong></p><p><strong>/opt/Jigsaw/Services/config.jams</strong></p><div class="code panel pdl" style="border-width: 1px;"><div class="codeContent panelContent pdl">
<pre class="syntaxhighlighter-pre" data-syntaxhighlighter-params="brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence" data-theme="Confluence">[host jamshost/24]
[virtualDB]
[replicator server=postgres://localhost/jmineops_lite,user=developer,password=GENERIC_PASSWORD;
        broadcast=jamsbroadcast:1109;
        broadcastCount=8;
        broadcastSize=4000;
        liveProxyTimeout=0]
[logger port=1110;enable=action,exception,optimizer,restriction]
[JAMS domain=jamshost:1109]
[mineOPS]
# [optimizer assign_by_idle=240;reassign_cost=240]
[diglineManager
        defaultExcavatorRadius=10;
        defaultLoaderRadius=10;
        defaultRadius=10;
        defaultShovelRadius=10;
        diggingMode=1]
[ruby]
[proxyTCP disconnect_if_busy=true]
[bundle JBusinessIntelligence]
[fastCGI port=127.0.0.1:5000]</pre>
</div></div><br/><p><strong><strong><strong>/opt/Jigsaw/Clients/lite</strong></strong></strong></p><div class="code panel pdl" style="border-width: 1px;"><div class="codeContent panelContent pdl">
<pre class="syntaxhighlighter-pre" data-syntaxhighlighter-params="brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Confluence" data-theme="Confluence">cd /opt/Jigsaw/Clients/
mkdir lite
ln -nfs lite client</pre>
</div></div><p><br/></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p><br/></p><p><br/></p></td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Basic Data Preparation:</p><ul style="list-style-type: square;"><li>Projection</li><li>Rotation</li><li>Operator</li><li>Locations</li><li>Status/Reason Code/TimeCategory</li><li>Grades</li></ul></td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td SmartScreen</td></tr></tbody></table></div><h2 id="OPFleetLite:GenericDatabase-CommisioningKey">Commisioning Key</h2><p>hmcmd.conf</p><div id="expander-899276021" class="expand-container"><div role="heading" aria-level="6" id="expander-control-899276021" class="expand-control"><button type="button" id="expand-button-899276021" class="aui-button aui-button-link aui-button-link-icon-text" id="OPFleetLite:GenericDatabase-DefaultSystemConfigurations">Default System Configurations</h1><p>For an easy deployment, the idea is to have a pre-defined system related configuration in the database, with default values but to be adjusted accordingly later on.</p><h2 id="OPFleetLite:GenericDatabase-DefaultCodes">Default Codes</h2><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable"><colgroup><col/><col/><col/><col/><col/><col/></colgroup><tbody><tr><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Module</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Devices</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTd">103</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr></tbody></table></div><h2 id="OPFleetLite:GenericDatabase-DefaultDistance">Default Distance</h2><p>Ideally set based on the size of truck and shovel.</p><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable"><colgroup class=""><col class=""/><col class=""/><col class=""/><col class=""/><col class=""/><col id="OPFleetLite:GenericDatabase-MiscSystemConfigurations">Misc System Configurations</h2><p>These configurations may affect equipment behavior:</p><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped class="confluenceTd">truck</td><td class="confluenceTd">JAMS</td><td class="confluenceTd">auto_ready_on_departure</td><td class="confluenceTd">always</td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Controls truck ready on departing an auto-delay location, value is one of the following departure options</p><ul><li>always</li><li>never</li><li>attended_only<ul><li>unattended_only</li></ul></li></ul></td></tr><tr class=""><td class="confluenceTd">action</td><td class="confluenceTd">truck</td><td class="confluenceTd">JAMS</td><td class="confluenceTd">overrideInvalidTonnage</td><td which will be triggered by payload sensor</td></tr><tr class=""><td class="confluenceTd">action</td><td class="confluenceTd">truck</td><td class="confluenceTd">JAMS</td><td destination when truck is in queued</td></tr><tr class=""><td class="confluenceTd">action</td><td class="confluenceTd">shovel</td><td class="confluenceTd">JAMS</td><td class="confluenceTd">action</td><td class="confluenceTd">truck</td><td class="confluenceTd">JAMS</td><td class="confluenceTd">reliable_payload</td><td class="confluenceTd">false</td><td hauling?</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p><br/></p><p>These configurations affecting Operator Panel (Web Panel)</p><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped relative-table confluenceTable" KPI's Config and KPI Screen.</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">break_reason</td><td class="confluenceTd">102</td><td class="confluenceTd">Reason code to be set when operator select the &quot;Lunch&quot; dock item</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">disable_hourmeter_sensor</td><td class="confluenceTd">true</td><td class="confluenceTd">Use this config to force manual input of the engine hours even if there is an hourmeter sensor present. If this value is false then the reading from the hourmeter sensor will be used if the hourmeter sensor exists.</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">disable_manual_hourmeter</td><td class="confluenceTd">false</td><td class="confluenceTd">if 'false' will prompt at fueling if enter_hours_with_fuel = 'false' or enter_hours_with_fuel = 'true' and time elapsed &lt; hourmeter_stale_time.<br/>If 'enter_hours_with_fuel' set to 'false' and 'disable_manual_hourmeter' set to 'true', Engine Hours input will hidden from the Refuel view</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">disable_payload_scaling</td><td class="confluenceTd">true</td><td class="confluenceTd">if set to 'true', the value for Tonnage Widget will be taken from truck size (??)</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">disallow_failed_login_override</td><td class="confluenceTd">false</td><td class="confluenceTd">When set to false (default) if login fails on a panel with a ConfirmException, (eg: due to lack of qualification to operate the device), the user will be allowed to override the login failure only if an operator is already logged in (assumed to be qualified in this case. If set to true, the user will get a simple message of the exception in the messages area.</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">emergency_down_code</td><td class="confluenceTd">104</td><td class="confluenceTd">If set, equipment will automatically change to relevant down status code after emergency timed out</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">emergency_timeout_seconds</td><td class="confluenceTd">10</td><td class="confluenceTd">Counter (in seconds) before automatically generate emergency event to dispatcher after operator press EMERGENCY button in the panel</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">truck</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">enable_activity_backing</td><td class="confluenceTd">true</td><td class="confluenceTd">Configure the Activity that the operator can't change manually. If the configuration is false for some activity, when the operator try to change to it on activity wheel, the system will generate a warning notification informing that the change is not allowed.</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">truck</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">enable_activity_hauling</td><td class="confluenceTd">true</td><td class="confluenceTd">Configure the Activity that the operator can't change manually. If the configuration is false for some activity, when the operator try to change to it on activity wheel, the system will generate a warning notification informing that the change is not allowed.</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">truck,shovel</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">enable_activity_loading</td><td class="confluenceTd">true</td><td class="confluenceTd">On Ruby Panel: Whether the 'loading' activity is shown in the ACTIVITY menu for the operators to select.<br/>On Web Panel: Configure the Activity that the operator can't change manually. If the configuration is false for some activity, when the operator try to change to it on activity wheel, the system will generate a warning notification informing that the change is not allowed.</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">truck</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">enable_activity_queued</td><td class="confluenceTd">true</td><td class="confluenceTd">On Ruby Panel: Whether the 'queued' activity is shown in the ACTIVITY menu for the operators to select.<br/>On Web Panel: Configure the Activity that the operator can't change manually. If the configuration is false for some activity, when the operator try to change to it on activity wheel, the system will generate a warning notification informing that the change is not allowed.</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">truck</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">enable_activity_spotting</td><td class="confluenceTd">true</td><td class="confluenceTd">Configure the Activity that the operator can't change manually. If the configuration is false for some activity, when the operator try to change to it on activity wheel, the system will generate a warning notification informing that the change is not allowed.</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">truck</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">enable_activity_tipping</td><td class="confluenceTd">true</td><td class="confluenceTd">On Ruby Panel: Whether the 'spotting' activity is shown in the ACTIVITY menu for the operators to select.<br/>On Web Panel: Configure the Activity that the operator can't change manually. If the configuration is false for some activity, when the operator try to change to it on activity wheel, the system will generate a warning notification informing that the change is not allowed.</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">truck</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">enable_activity_traveling</td><td class="confluenceTd">true</td><td class="confluenceTd">On Ruby Panel: Whether the 'traveling' activity is shown in the ACTIVITY menu for the operators to select.<br/>On Web Panel: Configure the Activity that the operator can't change manually. If the configuration is false for some activity, when the operator try to change to it on activity wheel, the system will generate a warning notification informing that the change is not allowed.</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">truck,shovel</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">enable_activity_waiting</td><td class="confluenceTd">true</td><td class="confluenceTd">On Ruby Panel: Whether the 'waiting' activity is shown in the ACTIVITY menu for the operators to select.<br/>On Web Panel: Configure the Activity that the operator can't change manually. If the configuration is false for some activity, when the operator try to change to it on activity wheel, the system will generate a warning notification informing that the change is not allowed.</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">enable_fuel_menu</td><td class="confluenceTd">true</td><td class="confluenceTd">If set to 'true', the FUEL / Refuel menu will be displayed on the main menu</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">enable_hazard_message</td><td class="confluenceTd">false</td><td class="confluenceTd">If set to 'true', panel will listen to 'hazard' notification from JAMS and display the message 'Hazard: %s within %s' in the message notification panel</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">enable_overload_message</td><td class="confluenceTd">false</td><td class="confluenceTd">if set to 'true', 'Overload: Payload %s exceeds %s' will be displayed on Panel</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">enable_truck_material_change</td><td class="confluenceTd">true</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">engine_hours_tolerance_min</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">enter_hours_with_fuel</td><td class="confluenceTd">true</td><td class="confluenceTd">if this is set to 'true' and time elapsed &gt; hourmeter_stale_time then hourmeter will prompt after fueling.<br/>If 'enter_hours_with_fuel' set to 'false' and 'disable_manual_hourmeter' set to 'true', Engine Hours input will hidden from the Refuel view</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment_force_activity</td><td class="confluenceTd">true</td><td class="confluenceTd">if set to 'true', activity changes made from panel will be send as 'forceActivity' to JAMS</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment_force_login_disable</td><td class="confluenceTd">true</td><td class="confluenceTd">If config &quot;equipment_force_login_disable&quot; is NOT 'true', login will always be forced, including allowing a rider to login as the operator.<br/>If it is true, the worker_qualifications will be checked by JAMS, an exception will be thrown if the worker does not have a worker_qualification for the equipment type. The user will have an option to override unless &quot;disallow_failed_login_override&quot;</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment_hazards_at_horizontal</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd">Distance (in meter) to loads the hazards layer from equipment position</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td elevation</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">force_prestart_comment_items</td><td with a trainer present</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td is failed (PrestartItem enum with 'critical' attribute)</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td Message.<br/>Each phrases can be split with ';' or '|'</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td enum</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">order_by_time_category</td><td class="confluenceTd">false</td><td class="confluenceTd">If set to 'true', the Equipment Reason selection will be grouped by Time Category enum</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">panel_assignment</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd">A semicolon-separated list of key=value pair to define what selections will be available to the operator during Unattended Mode<br/>When config key are not explicitly mentioned, it will be considered as false. The config key which can be enabled are:\n<br/><br/>* {{truck_dumps=true}}<br/>** Adds Dump Lock menu item to Unattended Mode view on Truck Panel.<br/>* {{dumps=true}} or {{dumps=show_all}}<br/>** Adds Dump/Stockpile menu item to Unattended Mode view on Shovel Panel<br/>* {{dumps=restricted}}<br/>** Only relevant when running ruby panel:<br/>*** Dump selection lists show only dumps which accept the material of interest (material being dug, loaded or hauled etc.)<br/>* {{dumps=...,locked}}<br/>** Only relevant when running ruby panel:<br/>*** Used in conjunction with other dumps values (eg. dumps=restricted,locked). Dump selection widget will update the locked dump rather than next dump.<br/>* {{shovel_assignments=true}}<br/>** Adds Single Assignment to Shovel menu item to Unattended Mode view on Truck Panel<br/>* {{locations=true}}<br/>** Adds Travel to Another Location menu item to Unattended Mode view on Truck Panel (all non-dump locations)<br/>* {{locations=classlist (eg. locations=Tiedown,FuelShop)}}<br/>** Adds Travel to Another Location menu item to Unattended Mode view on Truck Panel (of a type listed in classlist)</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">prestart</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd">Prestart type to be loaded. Can be set to equipment_type or default to relevant equipment class (i.e: Truck, Shovel).<br/>The relevant PrestartCheck name should be match</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">restroom_reason</td><td class="confluenceTd">102</td><td class="confluenceTd">Reason code to be set when operator select the &quot;Toilet&quot; dock item</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">ShellApp_map_config</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd">Default map configuration when application initialized (will get overidded from user_preferences later when operator logged in)</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">ShellApp_preferences</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd">Default preferences when application initialized (will get overidded from user_preferences later when operator logged in)</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td entered hours is greater than the previous entered hours</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">equipment</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">validate_hourmeter_with_range</td><td class="confluenceTd">false</td><td class="confluenceTd">Ensures the the entered hours is greater than the previous entered hours and is less than the engine hour plus the time that has elapsed since it was last entered</td></tr></tbody></table></div><h2 id="OPFleetLite:GenericDatabase-Configurationsspecificforhardware">Configurations specific for hardware</h2><p>DisplayX + SmartScreen</p><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable"><colgroup class=""><col class=""/><col class=""/><col class=""/><col                             Product: MineOperate OP Pro : 4.0-003 UAT
                        </span>

                    <div class="page-metadata">
                        
        
    
    
        
    
        
        
            Created by <span class='author'> GEORGE Nathan</span>, last modified on jul 24, 2025
                        </div>
                    <div id="main-content" class="wiki-content group">
                    <h2 id="id-4.0003UAT-UATScope">UAT Scope</h2><ol><li>Update Server &amp; Panel to <a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/SCM/4.0-003" rel="nofollow">4.0-003</a> in OP Product Team 4.0.3 UAT environment</li><li>Complete all post upgrade instructions</li><li>Validate system upgrade</li><li>Validate | UAT new features</li></ol><p><br/></p><h2 id="id-4.0003UAT-UATIssues">UAT Issues</h2><div id="expander-225168888" class="expand-container"><div role="heading" aria-level="6" id="expander-control-225168888" class="expand-control"><button type="button" id="expand-button-225168888" class="aui-button aui-button-link aui-button-link-icon-text" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="expander-content-225168888" ><span class="expand-icon aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-chevron-down" aria-hidden="true"></span><span class="expand-control-text conf-macro-render">Failed UAT Test</span></button></div><div role="region" id="expander-content-225168888" class="expand-content" aria-labelledby="expand-button-225168888"><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable"><colgroup><col/><col/><col/><col/><col/></colgroup><tbody><tr><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">UAT#</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Test</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">UAT Test Status</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Jira Link</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Issue Status</th></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">4.0.3.UAT01</td><td class="confluenceTd">Shell App fails to start post upgrade</td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="status-macro aui-lozenge aui-lozenge-error">FAILED</span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>
<span class="jira-issue lock-jira-issue IN-6209"
      data-jira-key="IN-6209" >
        <a class=issue-link" href="https://jira.hexagonmining.com/browse/IN-6209?src=confmacro">IN-6209</a>
        <span class="oauth-msg"> -
            <a class="static-oauth-init" href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/plugins/servlet/applinks/oauth/login-dance/authorize?applicationLinkID=ab53f6db-1037-3a9d-bb3c-d8ebd242d4b5">Autenticar</a> para ver datos del tique
        </span>
    </span>
</p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Work around provided. Database records causing database error deleted</p></div></td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">4.0.3.UAT02</td><td class="confluenceTd">Shell App | Defect View cannot be disabled</td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="status-macro aui-lozenge aui-lozenge-error">FAILED</span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>

clarification which Shell App release (1.2.9 or 1.3) is supported in 4.0-003 <a class="confluence-userlink user-mention" data-username="VIFA" href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/~VIFA" Fabio</a> </span></li></ul><p>Clarification/Answer</p><p><a class="confluence-userlink user-mention" data-username="GENA" href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/~GENA" data-linked-resource-id="202706461" data-linked-resource-version="2" data-linked-resource-type="userinfo" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com">GEORGE Nathan</a> , ShellApp 1.2.9 is the supported one for OP Pro 4.0-003</p><p>Just in case it is need to validate other component versions, please refer to the versions listed on the 4.0-003 patch registry page we created and use as a reference the <a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/JP/4.0-003#:~:text=20%20Jan%202025-,4.0%2D003.001,-MOPS%2D28157%20%2D" rel="nofollow">most recent package version available</a>.</p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Release notes refer to Shell App 1.3.0-rc02 or greater but 4.0-003 release artifacts only include Shell App 1.2.9<br/><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" height="250" src="attachments/377574052/377574097.png" Application-Architectures-supported-in-3.x_267387170.html


<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
    <head>
        <title>Product: MineOperate OP Pro : Application Architectures supported in 3.x</title>
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles/site.css" type="text/css" />
        <META http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8">
    </head>

    <body class="theme-default aui-theme-default">
        <div id="page">
            <div id="main" class="aui-page-panel">
                <div id="main-header">
                    <div id="breadcrumb-section">
                        <ol id="breadcrumbs">
                            <li class="first">
                                <span><a href="index.html">Product: MineOperate OP Pro</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                    <li>
                                <span><a href="MineOperate-OP-Pro_224018004.html">MineOperate OP Pro</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                    <li>
                                <span><a href="Product-Releases_228590211.html">Product Releases</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                    <li>
                                <span><a href="OP-Pro-3.0_231785728.html">OP Pro 3.0</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                    <li>
                                <span><a href="OP-Pro-3.0-Architecture_231786246.html">OP Pro 3.0 Architecture</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                </ol>
                    </div>
                    <h1 id="title-heading" class="pagetitle">
                                                <span id="title-text">
                            Product: MineOperate OP Pro : Application Architectures supported in 3.x
                        </span>
                    </h1>
                </div>

                <div id="content" class="view">
                    <div class="page-metadata">
                        
        
    
    
        
    
        
        
            Created by <span class='author'> GEORGE Nathan</span>, last modified on nov 07, 2022
                        </div>
                    <div id="main-content" class="wiki-content group">
                    <p>The OP Pro 3.0 release supports a hybrid 2.8 and 3.0/3.1 Application Architecture</p><p><br/></p><div class="panel" style="border-width: 1px;"><div class="panelHeader" style="border-bottom-width: 1px;"><b>2.8 Architecture</b></div><div class="panelContent">
<ul><li>Legacy Ruby GTK LP and Ruby GTK + OreNav HP 32 bit applications supported</li><li>Applications and components installed and run on the Display 9</li><li>JAMS functions as the application service between the Onboard device and Server</li><li>All Server to Field device communications and data replication is done through JAMS</li><li>Core &amp; UHP devices are used as a sensor &amp; communications device</li></ul><p><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" height="400" src="attachments/267387170/267388016.png" data-image-src="attachments/267387170/267388016.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="267388016" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="image2022-5-11_11-44-49.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="267387170" data-linked-resource-container-version="7" alt=""></span></p>
</div></div><div class="panel" style="border-width: 1px;"><div class="panelHeader" style="border-bottom-width: 1px;"><b>3.0 Architecture</b></div><div class="panelContent">
<ul><li>Web application runs in Chromium browser on Display</li><li>Application Services &amp; Database (GVOS, JAMS, SQLite) run on the Core device</li><li>GVOS functions as the application service between the Onboard device and Server</li><li>All Server to Field device communications and data replication is done through GVOS</li><li>The use of the Onboard web applications can be managed through device configurations.  This allow customers to maintain the use of 2.8 applications but migrate to 3.0 onboard web applications in a managed way.</li><li>UHP is not supported to run the 3.0 Architecture due to it not meeting the minimum CPU processing requirements.</li><li>Currently, only Shovel LP and Truck LP web panels are supported.  However, Aux LP and HP web panels will be supported in future OP Pro releases.</li></ul><p><br/></p><p><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" height="400" src="attachments/267387170/267388018.png" data-image-src="attachments/267387170/267388018.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="267388018" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="image2022-5-11_11-45-31.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="267387170" data-linked-resource-container-version="7" alt=""></span></p>
</div></div>
                    </div>

                                                            <div class="pageSection group">
                        <div class="pageSectionHeader">
                            <h2 id="attachments" class="pageSectionTitle">Attachments:</h2>
                        </div>

                        <div class="greybox" align="left">
                                                            <img src="images/icons/bullet_blue.gif" height="8" width="8" alt=""/>
                                <a href="attachments/267387170/267388006.png">image2022-5-11_11-36-2.png</a> (image/png)
                                <br/>
                                                            <img src="images/icons/bullet_blue.gif" height="8" width="8" alt=""/>
                                <a href="attachments/267387170/267388011.png">image2022-5-11_11-38-39.png</a> (image/png)
                                <br/>
                                                            <img src="images/icons/bullet_blue.gif" height="8" width="8" alt=""/>
                                <a href="attachments/267387170/267388016.png">image2022-5-11_11-44-49.png</a> (image/png)
                                <br/>
                                                            <img src="images/icons/bullet_blue.gif" height="8" width="8" alt=""/>
                                <a href="attachments/267387170/267388018.png">image2022-5-11_11-45-31.png</a> (image/png)
                                <br/>
                                                    </div>
                    </div>
                    
                                                      
                </div>             </div> 
            <div id="footer" role="contentinfo">
                <section class="footer-body">
                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on dic 05, 2025 11:18</p>
                    <div id="footer-logo"><a href="https://www.atlassian.com/">Atlassian</a></div>
                </section>
            </div>
        </div>     </body>
</html>
