How-to-read-raw-data-of-OEM-PLM_317035391.html


<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
    <head>
        <title>Product: MineOperate OP Pro : How to read raw data of OEM PLM</title>
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles/site.css" type="text/css" />
        <META http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8">
    </head>

    <body class="theme-default aui-theme-default">
        <div id="page">
            <div id="main" class="aui-page-panel">
                <div id="main-header">
                    <div id="breadcrumb-section">
                        <ol id="breadcrumbs">
                            <li class="first">
                                <span><a href="index.html">Product: MineOperate OP Pro</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                    <li>
                                <span><a href="MineOperate-OP-Pro_224018004.html">MineOperate OP Pro</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                </ol>
                    </div>
                    <h1 id="title-heading" class="pagetitle">
                                                <span id="title-text">
                            Product: MineOperate OP Pro : How to read raw data of OEM PLM
                        </span>
                    </h1>
                </div>

                <div id="content" class="view">
                    <div class="page-metadata">
                        
        
    
    
        
    
        
        
            Created by <span class='author'> SOUGY Alfian</span>, last modified on oct 16, 2023
                        </div>
                    <div id="main-content" class="wiki-content group">
                    <p>Objective: If you try to find how to read raw data of PLM when you are troubleshooting from the physical layer/interface stage, this page will be your starting point, as it will breakdown the PLM raw data based on PLM II Documents<br/><br/>Link to the parent page: <a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=50992821" rel="nofollow">PlmII/PlmIII - Jigsaw OEM Interfaces - Hexagon's Mining division Confluence (hexagonmining.com)</a><br/><br/>PLM is Using Serial RS232 to communicate with others, then we will need setup like this below</p><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable"><colgroup><col/><col/><col/><col/><col/></colgroup><tbody><tr><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Serial</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Hardware flow control</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Parity</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Baud rate</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Stop Bit</th></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">RS232</td><td class="confluenceTd">No</td><td class="confluenceTd">No</td><td class="confluenceTd">9600</td><td class="confluenceTd">1 stop bit</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p><br/></p><p>To be successful in receiving and requesting the data, the communication should be like this below<br/><br/><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" height="250" src="attachments/317035391/317035362.png" data-image-src="attachments/317035391/317035362.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="317035362" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="image-2023-10-16_13-20-33.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="317035391" data-linked-resource-container-version="2" alt=""></span></p><p>To get to know the raw data in PLM will have consist of STX,DATA,ETX,BCC</p><ol><li>Leica is requesting data to PLM controller with Real Time Message 'M' '2' command in hex : 0x024d32037e<br/>- STX(message start) = 0x02 (1 byte)<br/>- M2 (in ASCII) = 0x4d32 (2 bytes)<br/>- ETX(message end) = 0x03 (1 byte)<br/>- BCC(checksum) = 0x7e (1 byte unsigned)<br/>The BCC/checksum is the XOR of all bytes from 02 to 03, BCC = 02 ^ 4d then BCC ^= 32 then BCC ^= 03<br/><br/></li><li>PLM will send the ACK but the time it sends is typically at the same time the data is send to Leica, then the data will look like this hex string below<br/>0x02060307<span><span class="ui-provider ef brp bic ckd ckf ckg ckh cki ckj ckk ckl ckm ckn cko ckp ckq ckr cks ckt cku ckv ckw ckx cky ckz cla clb clc cld cle clf clg clh cli clj">024d3210020000821002db10028a051800fe0100100300001003035d</span></span><br/>The ACK is = 0x02060307<br/>- STX = 0x02<br/>- Message successfully send = 0x06<br/>- ETX = 0x03<br/>- BCC = 07<br/>The hex string consists of data after ACK 0x<span><span class="ui-provider ef brp bic ckd ckf ckg ckh cki ckj ckk ckl ckm ckn cko ckp ckq ckr cks ckt cku ckv ckw ckx cky ckz cla clb clc cld cle clf clg clh cli clj">024d3210020000821002db10028a051800fe0100100300001003035d</span></span><br/>- STX = 0x02<br/>- M2 = 0x4d32<br/>- Data in hex = 0x<span><span class="ui-provider ef brp bic ckd ckf ckg ckh cki ckj ckk ckl ckm ckn cko ckp ckq ckr cks ckt cku ckv ckw ckx cky ckz cla clb clc cld cle clf clg clh cli clj">10020000821002db10028a051800fe0100100300001003</span></span><br/>- ETX = 0x03<br/>- BCC/Checksum = 0x5d<br/>We will need to clean the raw data in hex that we got as there should be only 18 bytes long or 20 bytes long with M2 and from the origin example we got 23 bytes<br/>The rule in PLM:<br/>STX=0x02; DLE=0x10; ETX=0x03<br/>If there are STX,DLE or ETX byte in raw data it will be appended with DLE before that byte, example if in data 0x0203 it will be like 0x10021003<br/>Then with data we have there should be like this after cleaning up additional DLE<br/>Final data in hex = 0x<span><span class="ui-provider ef brp bic ckd ckf ckg ckh cki ckj ckk ckl ckm ckn cko ckp ckq ckr cks ckt cku ckv ckw ckx cky ckz cla clb clc cld cle clf clg clh cli clj">0200008202db028a051800fe010003000003<br/><br/></span></span></li><li><span><span class="ui-provider ef brp bic ckd ckf ckg ckh cki ckj ckk ckl ckm ckn cko ckp ckq ckr cks ckt cku ckv ckw ckx cky ckz cla clb clc cld cle clf clg clh cli clj">After we cleaned up the raw data we can point which data in the raw data based on the bytes position as shown below <br/>for not making confusion i will add M2 to match the table to be have 20 bytes long<br/>Final PLM Raw = 0x4d320200008202db028a051800fe010003000003<br/><br/><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" height="250" src="attachments/317035391/317035383.png" data-image-src="attachments/317035391/317035383.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="317035383" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="image-2023-10-16_13-58-36.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="317035391" data-linked-resource-container-version="2" alt=""></span><br/><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" height="250" src="attachments/317035391/317035384.png" data-image-src="attachments/317035391/317035384.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="317035384" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="image-2023-10-16_13-58-58.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="317035391" data-linked-resource-container-version="2" alt=""></span><br/><br/>As we can see above the byte position in this raw data is matter, it should be easy to point which data you want to extract based on the table above, and it's pretty easy as PLM like the data which has 2 bytes is stored as little endianness then we need to swap the bytes before we convert it to decimal, ok for example the payload is at byte order 13 and 14, the byte at 13 is 0xfe and 14 is 0x01 so it will be 0x01fe in decimal is 510, and also we need to check the truck size at byte 2nd is 0x02, in document is metric ton <em> </em>10 but it should be metric ton 0.1 so the payload is 51.0 ton<br/><br/></span></span></li><li><span><span class="ui-provider ef brp bic ckd ckf ckg ckh cki ckj ckk ckl ckm ckn cko ckp ckq ckr cks ckt cku ckv ckw ckx cky ckz cla clb clc cld cle clf clg clh cli clj">Ok we have done elaborating the PLM raw data, After we got the data, leica need to send ACK &amp; quit message in hex to PLM<br/>ACK = 0x02060307, 0x06 means successfully read, or NACK = 0x02150314, 0x15 means not successfully read<br/><br/>Quit message = 0x0251320362<br/>STX = 0x02<br/>Quit message = 0x5132<br/>ETX = 0x03<br/>BCC = 0x62 <br/><br/></span></span></li><li><span><span class="ui-provider ef brp bic ckd ckf ckg ckh cki ckj ckk ckl ckm ckn cko ckp ckq ckr cks ckt cku ckv ckw ckx cky ckz cla clb clc cld cle clf clg clh cli clj">After PLM got the quit message from Leica, PLM will send ACK back to leica<br/>ACK = 0x02060307</span></span></li></ol><p><span><span class="ui-provider ef brp bic ckd ckf ckg ckh cki ckj ckk ckl ckm ckn cko ckp ckq ckr cks ckt cku ckv ckw ckx cky ckz cla clb clc cld cle clf clg clh cli clj"><br/>And it will be repeated over the time, based on what i check if the PLM respond M2 request the next request from leica will be every 2 seconds and if not will be every 5 seconds </span></span></p><p><br/></p>
                    </div>

                                                            <div class="pageSection group">
                        <div class="pageSectionHeader">

    </head>

    <body class="theme-default aui-theme-default">
        <div id="page">
            <div id="main" class="aui-page-panel">
                <div id="main-header">
                    <div id="breadcrumb-section">
                        <ol id="breadcrumbs">
                            <li class="first">
                                <span><a href="index.html">Product: MineOperate OP Pro</a></span>

                                <span><a href="MineOperate-OP-Pro_224018004.html">MineOperate OP Pro</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                    <li>
                                <span><a href="Product-Information_224018007.html">Product Information</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                </ol>
                    </div>
                    <h1 id="title-heading" class="pagetitle">
                                                <span id="title-text">
                            Product: MineOperate OP Pro : JView
                        </span>
                    </h1>
                </div>

                <div id="content" class="view">
                    <div class="page-metadata">
                        
        
    
    
        
    
        
        
            Created by <span class='author'> GEORGE Nathan</span>, last modified on nov 15, 2020
                        </div>
                    <div id="main-content" class="wiki-content group">
                    <div id="expander-303523375" class="expand-container"><div role="heading" aria-level="6" id="expander-control-303523375" class="expand-control"><button type="button" id="expand-button-303523375" class="aui-button aui-button-link aui-button-link-icon-text" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="expander-content-303523375" ><span class="expand-icon aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-chevron-down" aria-hidden="true"></span><span class="expand-control-text conf-macro-render">Overview</span></button></div><div role="region" id="expander-content-303523375" class="expand-content" aria-labelledby="expand-button-303523375"><p><span>The Jigsaw Jview business intelligence (BI) standard report suite was developed to provide out-of-the-box reporting functionality at installation and seamless upgrades and enhancements for reporting on the Jigsaw Jmineops system.  There are many components that encapsulate BI in Jview.</span><p><span>Information provided by Jmineops enables users to have greater control of the operations and production environment.  Jmineops optimizes and centralizes equipment tracking, dispatching and diagnostics ensuring that activities and operators can be directed, material movement can be confirmed, and machine health can be monitored within a comprehensive pragmatic reporting structure.  </span></p><p><span>The product suite is built on Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2/2014 Standard (MSQL) technologies.  It follows industry standard methods for data warehousing and report structure.  This includes SQL Server, Reporting Services (SSRS) and Analysis Services (SSAS).  The Jview web application serves the reporting components to the end user utilizing the Report Server as content.</span></p><p><span>Since there are many levels of data consumers at a mine (even within a mining company, having many separate mine sites) Jview is structured to provide content tailored for different use and analysis.  </span></p><p><span><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" width="600" src="attachments/153747868/153747875.png" data-image-src="attachments/153747868/153747875.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="153747875" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="Leica_Jigsaw_Jview.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="153747868" data-linked-resource-container-version="3" alt=""></span><br/></span></p><p><span>The standard report suite comprises a combination of content depending on the need for information, the interval, quantity, and purpose.</span></p><ul><li><span> </span><span><strong>Dashboards</strong> <strong>for near real-time information</strong>.  Generally designed to provide operational intelligence focused on change, and proactive action.  The objective is having the most important information, a consolidation and arrangement of data in one view to achieve goals or identify problems.</span></li><li><span> </span><span><strong>Static layout reports</strong> <strong>for common daily and operational reports</strong>.  Generally designed to be printed and or emailed, for shift, daily, and weekly on production, maintenance, and operational metrics.  Some reports are laid out like scorecards for general month to date and aggregated reporting.</span></li><li><span> </span><span><strong>Dynamic layout pseudo pivot reports</strong> for common longer term analysis, allow for some flexibility in aggregated exploration but still within a standard web browser.  They are used to access the SSAS database cubes through Jview without needing Excel, for greater periods of time.</span></li><li><span> </span><span><strong>SSAS OLAP database cubes for ad-hoc reporting and in depth analysis</strong>.  Modelled for slicing and dicing data over greater dimensions and periods of time with pivot charts and pivot tables.  Cubes are browsed using Microsoft Excel™ 2007 and greater with a standard OLE DB connection.  Workbooks can be saved locally, emailed or shared within the common Microsoft framework of tools and applications.  There are excellent analytics add-ins for Excel including PowerPivot (2010), PowerView (2013), and PowerMap (2013) that make data interaction rich and insightful.</span></li></ul><p><span>Jview renders dashboards, static and dynamic reports in the Jview web application that can be viewed on network computers and many other devices with internet browsers connected to the WIFI network, including mobile phones and tablets.  Please see the Jigsaw Jview Standard report list for more detailed explanation.</span></p><p><span>Custom extended content utilizing any of the components of Jview can be created, appended or added.  The platform allows for modifications and extension to existing standard content or new reports, dashboards, or cubes.  Clients can own and customize their data and the artifacts.  Content can be shared between installations and sites as well.  Creating and extending content is done easily with Microsoft SQL Server Report Builder™ 3.0.</span></p><p><span>Jview is a simple, flexible platform that is extendable and allows customization to content delivery across the operation.  It is critical to get supervisors the information so they can make decisions on the spot, out in the field.  With many new technologies; smart phones, tablets and 3G networks, data can now be pushed out more efficiently to these devices.  Interface layout and design is critical because visualizations are viewed differently on various devices and situations.  Visual analysis contributes significantly to the discovery, interpretation, and insight.   Matching content with users’ skills and purpose enhances interactivity and engagement.</span></p><p><span>From dispatcher, to analyst, to management, Jigsaw makes it possible for individuals and teams to control the environment and discover the information they need while subtly hiding the fact that they are using data and instead gaining knowledge, when it has to be right.<br/><br/> </span></p><div><span><br/></span></div></p></div></div><div id="expander-2080106444" class="expand-container"><div role="heading" aria-level="6" id="expander-control-2080106444" class="expand-control"><button type="button" id="expand-button-2080106444" class="aui-button aui-button-link aui-button-link-icon-text" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="expander-content-2080106444" ><span class="expand-icon aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-chevron-down" aria-hidden="true"></span><span class="expand-control-text conf-macro-render">Installation</span></button></div><div role="region" id="expander-content-2080106444" class="expand-content" aria-labelledby="expand-button-2080106444"><p><strong>OverView</strong><p>The Jigsaw Business Intelligence products consists of several programs and content artifacts that are used to provide BI reporting for mining operations. <br/>These products use the Microsoft SQL Server's Reporting Services as a platform to provide users of JMineops.</p><p>The links below refers to pages that describe how to build, deploy and configure the Jigsaw Business Intelligence programs and reporting artifacts. <br/>These products cannot be used/installed until the Microsoft Reporting Server is installed and running.<br/><br/><style type='text/css'>/*<![CDATA[*/
div.rbtoc1764958714133 {padding: 0px;}
div.rbtoc1764958714133 ul {margin-left: 0px;}
div.rbtoc1764958714133 li {margin-left: 0px;padding-left: 0px;}

/*]]>*/</style><div class='toc-macro rbtoc1764958714133'>
<ul class='toc-indentation'>
<li><a href='#JView-WindowsServer2008R2Standardx64&amp;SQLServer2008R2Standardx64'>Windows Server 2008 R2 Standard x64 &amp; SQL Server 2008 R2 Standard x64</a>
<ul class='toc-indentation'>
<li><a href='#JView-TheMicrosoftserverrequirementsare:'>The Microsoft server requirements are:</a></li>
<li><a href='#JView-Relatedarticles'>Related articles</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><a href='#JView-WindowsServer2012R2Standardx64&amp;SQLServer2014StandardEditionx64'>Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard x64 &amp; SQL Server 2014 Standard Edition x64</a>
<ul class='toc-indentation'>
<li><a href='#JView-1.JViewInstallationPreparation(ImpNote:Pleasenotethatthescreenshotsbelowareforreferenceonlyandmaynotrepresentindividualinstallation)'>1. JView Installation Preparation (Imp Note: Please note that the screenshots below are for reference only and may not represent individual installation)</a>
<ul class='toc-indentation'>
<li><a href='#JView-Pre-requisites:TheMicrosoftServerRequirements:'>Pre-requisites: The Microsoft Server Requirements:</a></li>

</ul>
</li>
<li><a href='#JView-3.BI-JViewandAdministrationUtilityInstallation'>3. BI - JView and Administration Utility Installation</a>
<ul class='toc-indentation'>

<li><a href='#JView-InstallingtheJSBIAdminTool'>Installing the JSBI Admin Tool</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><a href='#JView-4.BI-JViewWebsiteArtifactInstallation'>4. BI - JView Website Artifact Installation</a>
<ul class='toc-indentation'>
<li><a href='#JView-Overview.1'>Overview</a></li>
<li><a href='#JView-ReportArtifactInstallationSteps'>Report Artifact Installation Steps</a></li>
<li><a href='#JView-JSBIAdmininstallerargumentdescription:'>JSBIAdmin installer argument description:</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</div></p><h1 id="JView-WindowsServer2008R2Standardx64&amp;SQLServer2008R2Standardx64"><strong><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);">Windows Server 2008 R2 Standard x64 &amp; SQL Server 2008 R2</span> Standard x64</strong></h1><h2 id="JView-TheMicrosoftserverrequirementsare:"><strong>The Microsoft server requirements are:</strong></h2><ul><li>Windows Server 2008 R2 Standard x64 O.S.</li><li>Microsoft .Net 3.5 (for runtime)</li><li>Micosoft SQL Server 2008 R2 Standard x64 with Reporting and Analysis Services</li></ul><p>For hardware requirements please refer to the Microsoft site for your operating system and products that will be installed on the server.<br/>The following pages have instructions on how to install the programs and content to provide the Jigsaw Business Intelligence Solution. <br/>They should be followed in order. If performing and update for a particular part of the solution then go to that particular page.</p><h2 id="JView-Relatedarticles"><strong>Related articles</strong></h2><p><a class="external-link" href="http://10.76.11.167/wiki/index.php/Mining/DesertFox/jViewBuild" rel="nofollow">Building Business Intelligence Applications and Report Bundles</a><br/><a class="external-link" href="http://10.76.11.167/wiki/index.php/Mining/DesertFox/TotalViewPrep" rel="nofollow">Jview Installation prep</a><br/><a class="external-link" href="http://10.76.11.167/wiki/index.php/Mining/DesertFox/JSON_Data_Extension_Install_and_User_Guide" rel="nofollow">BI- JSON Data Extension Installation &amp; User Guide</a><br/><a class="external-link" href="http://10.76.11.167/wiki/index.php/Mining/DesertFox/TotalViewInstallation" rel="nofollow">BI- Jview and Administration Utility Installation</a><br/><a class="external-link" href="http://10.76.11.167/wiki/index.php/Mining/DesertFox/Talk:TotalViewReportContentInstallation" rel="nofollow">BI- Jview Website Artifact Installation</a></p><p>











<ul class="content-by-label">
        <li>
        <div>
                <span class="icon aui-icon content-type-page" title="Página">Página:</span>        </div>

        <div class="details">
                        <a href="/display/TVIEW/Jview+Installation+Home">Jview Installation Home</a>
                
                        
                    </div>
    </li>
        <li>
        <div>
                <span class="icon aui-icon content-type-page" title="Página">Página:</span>        </div>

        <div class="details">
                        <a href="/display/TVIEW/How-To+Install+Jview+Bundles+for+testing">How-To Install Jview Bundles for testing</a>
                
                        
                    </div>
    </li>
    </ul>
</p><p> </p><p>Basic steps to setup a Windows Server 2008 R2 installation in preparation for TotalView2 </p><ul style="margin-left: 1.5em;"><li>Install SQL Server 2008 R2 with both windows and SQL authentication. Install all options.</li><li>Add JSBIAdmin user as both an SA user and a system user. Password should be Jigsaw1</li><li>Connect to the database engine&gt;&gt;Security&gt;&gt;Logins&gt;&gt;New Login (RMB the Logins and select New Login) and add Public, Sysadmin server roles to this login<br/><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" width="600" src="attachments/42042453/52494487.png" data-image-src="attachments/42042453/52494487.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="52494487" data-linked-resource-version="3" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="QA_Server.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="42042453" data-linked-resource-container-version="50" alt=""></span></li><li>Add an empty jmineops database to sql and replicate data. Note (Add steps to replicate the DBs)</li><li>In the server management console, add an IIS role if the server is not configured for it. The options should be basic authentication, windows authentication, and <a class="external-link" href="http://ASP.net" rel="nofollow">ASP.net</a> add on.</li><li>Run powershell as an administrator, then unblock powershell execution with the following. </li></ul><pre>$ set-executionPolicy unrestricted
</pre><ul style="margin-left: 1.5em;"><li>Add JSBIAdmin to reporting services security role.</li><li>Go to theReport Manger URL&gt;&gt;Site Settings&gt;&gt;Security&gt;&gt;New Role Assignment</li><li>Select both roles (System Administrator and System User)</li></ul><p><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" width="600" src="attachments/42042453/52494487.png" data-image-src="attachments/42042453/52494487.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="52494487" data-linked-resource-version="3" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="QA_Server.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="42042453" data-linked-resource-container-version="50" alt=""></span></p><ul><li>Go to Home folder&gt;&gt;Folder Settings&gt;&gt;Security&gt;&gt;New Role Assignment</li><li>Add JSBIAdmin Group/User Name and assign all but &quot;My Reports&quot; role</li></ul><p><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" width="600" src="attachments/42042453/52494488.png" data-image-src="attachments/42042453/52494488.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="52494488" data-linked-resource-version="3" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="QA_Server .png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="42042453" data-linked-resource-container-version="50" alt=""></span></p><ul style="margin-left: 1.5em;"><li>Add the JSBIAdmin to analysis server users</li><li>Connect to the Analysis Server, RMB the Server node and go to the properties&gt;&gt;Security and add JSBIAdmin as a new server role<br/><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" width="600" src="attachments/42042453/52494487.png" data-image-src="attachments/42042453/52494487.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="52494487" data-linked-resource-version="3" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="QA_Server.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="42042453" data-linked-resource-container-version="50" alt=""></span></li><li>Add the extended stored procedures dll and files to Program Files/Mineops<br/><div>1. Check if you are running a 32 or 64 bit OS</div><div>     On your SQL Server go to:</div><div>     Start/All Programs/Accessories/System Tools/System Information</div><div><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" width="600" src="attachments/42042453/52494515.png" data-image-src="attachments/42042453/52494515.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="52494515" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="SystemInformation.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="42042453" data-linked-resource-container-version="50" alt=""></span></div><div>2. Download <a class="external-link" href="http://10.7.0.9/Packages/win32/MSSQLProcs.zip%C2%A0" rel="nofollow">http://10.7.0.9/Packages/win32/MSSQLProcs.zip </a>;</div><div>3. Unzip MSSQLProcs.zip  at C:\Program Files\</div><div>4. If your OS is 32 bit skip this step:</div><div>     Download <a class="external-link" href="http://10.7.0.9/Packages/win64/MSSQLProcs-1.dll" rel="nofollow">http://10.7.0.9/Packages/win64/MSSQLProcs-1.dll</a></div><div><strong>      </strong>and replace the existent library in C:\Program Files\MineOPS\Jigsaw\Tools\<div>5. Add a system environment variable:</div><div>     Go to Start/ </div><div>     Right click Computer/Properties/Advanced system settings</div><div>     Click on the Environment Variables button </div><div>     In the System Variable sections click New</div><div>     Variable name: TZDIR</div><div>     Variable Value: c:\Program Files\MineOPS\share\zoneinfo</div><div>6. Find out the time zone the database is to report on:</div><div>     In Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio </div><div>     run the following query against your database </div><div>     SELECT timezone FROM rotations</div><div>     Example Output: Africa/Freetown</div><div>7. Change directory  to c:\Program Files\MineOPS\share\zoneinfo </div><div>     Find the file specified by the output of step (6) and change it's name to localtime </div><div>     With the current example, you would go to the Africa directory and rename Freetown to localtime</div></div></li><li>Load the extensions.msql to the master SQL db from a Jams install using xml_loader.<ul><li>Load terminal from your local computer and log in to the linux server</li><li>In the terminal, run the following command (make sure to edit the database name)<ul><li><p>cd /opt/Jigsaw/Library/jmineops/db/SQLServer/</p></li><li><p>/opt/Jigsaw/Tools/xml_loader -database <a href="sqlserver://jview_test/master,username=JSBIAdmin,password=Jigsaw1" rel="nofollow">sqlserver://jview_test/master,username=JSBIAdmin,password=Jigsaw1</a> extensions.msql</p><p><strong><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Note: Add free tds notes<br/></span></strong></p><p><strong><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><br/></span></strong></p></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul><h1 id="JView-WindowsServer2012R2Standardx64&amp;SQLServer2014StandardEditionx64"><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><strong><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);">Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard x64 &amp; SQL Server 2014 Standard Edition x64</span> </strong></span></h1><h2 class="p1" id="JView-1.JViewInstallationPreparation(ImpNote:Pleasenotethatthescreenshotsbelowareforreferenceonlyandmaynotrepresentindividualinstallation)"><span class="s1"><strong><span style="color: rgb(51,102,255);">1. JView Installation Preparation <br/>(Imp Note: Please note that the screenshots below are for reference only and may not represent individual installation)</span></strong></span></h2><h3 id="JView-Pre-requisites:TheMicrosoftServerRequirements:"><strong>Pre-requisites: <br/>The Microsoft Server Requirements:</strong></h3><ul><li>Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard x64 O.S.</li><li>Microsoft .Net 3.5 (for runtime)</li><li>Micosoft SQL Server 2014 Standard x64 with Reporting and Analysis Services</li></ul><p>For hardware requirements please refer to the Microsoft site for your operating system and products that will be installed on the server.<br/>The following sections provide instructions on how to install the programs and content to provide the Jigsaw Business Intelligence Solution. <br/>They should be followed in order. If performing an update for a particular part of the solution then go to that sub-section.</p><h3 class="p1" id="JView-BasicstepstosetupaWindowsServer2012R2installationinpreparationforJView."><strong><span>Basic steps to setup a Windows Server 2012 R2 installation in preparation for JView.</span></strong></h3><div class="page" title="Page 2"><div class="layoutArea"><div class="column"><ol><li><p><span>Create a Windows user for our software to use. Go to the </span><span>Windows Server Manager </span><span>and expand the </span><span>Configuration </span><span>under the left panel. Expand the </span><span>Local users and Groups </span><span>section and right click on the </span><span>Users </span><span>folder. Select </span><span>New User</span><span>. <br class="_mce_tagged_br"/></span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Type in the username of </span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">JSBIAdmin </span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">with the description Jigsaw into the fields. The password should be </span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Jigsaw1</span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">. Make sure to select the check box for the password to never expire.<br/></span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Make the JSBIAdmin user a member of the </span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Administrators </span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">group. Right-click on JSBIAdmin and select </span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Properties</span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">. Select </span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Member Of </span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Tab, Press &lt;ADD&gt;, type “Administrators” in the Text box and press &lt;CHECK NAMES&gt;. Press &lt;OK&gt; all the way back. <br/>Similarly, add JSBIAdmin user a member of the Remote Desktop Users group </span></p></li><li class="p1"><p>In the server management console, add an IIS role if the server is not configured for it. <br/>a. Server Roles&gt;Web Server (IIS)&gt;Web Server&gt;Security, then add basic authentication, windows authentication.<br/>b. Server Roles&gt;Web Server (IIS)&gt;Web Server&gt;Application Development, then select all add-ons.<br/>c. Server Roles&gt;Web Server (IIS)&gt;Management Tools, then select all add-ons.<br/>d. Features&gt;.NET FRAMEWORK 4.5 Features, then select ASP.NET 4.5<br/>e. Make sure .NET framework 3.5 is also installed if not then install from Features&gt;.NET FRAMEWORK 3.5 Features, then select .NET framework 3.5 (Includes 2.0 and 3.0)</p><p><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" width="600" src="attachments/42042453/53904174.png" data-image-src="attachments/42042453/53904174.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="53904174" data-linked-resource-version="2" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="1.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="42042453" data-linked-resource-container-version="50" alt=""></span></p><p><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" width="600" src="attachments/42042453/53904174.png" data-image-src="attachments/42042453/53904174.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="53904174" data-linked-resource-version="2" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="1.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="42042453" data-linked-resource-container-version="50" alt=""></span></p><p><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" width="600" src="attachments/42042453/53904175.png" data-image-src="attachments/42042453/53904175.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="53904175" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="2.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="42042453" data-linked-resource-container-version="50" alt=""></span></p></li></ol></div></div></div><h3 class="p1" id="JView-Basicstepstoinstall/setupaSQLSERVER2014Std.x64inpreparationforJView."><strong><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">Basic steps to install/setup a SQL SERVER 2014 Std. x64 in preparation for JView.</span></strong></h3><ul style="margin-left: 1.5em;"><li class="p2"><p>Install SQL Server 2014 Std. with both windows and SQL authentication. Install all options.</p></li><li class="p1"><p><span class="s2"><span class="s2">Add JSBIAdmin user as both an SA user and a system user. Password should be Jigsaw1<br/></span></span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Connect to the database engine&gt;&gt;Security&gt;&gt;Logins&gt;&gt;New Login (RMB the Logins and select New Login) and add Public, Sysadmin server roles to this login</span><span class="s2"> <br/><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" width="600" src="attachments/42042453/54951967.png" data-image-src="attachments/42042453/54951967.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="54951967" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="123.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="42042453" data-linked-resource-container-version="50" alt=""></span> </span></p></li><li class="p1"><span class="s2"><span class="s2">Add JSBIAdmin to reporting services security role.<br/></span></span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Go to the Report Manager URL&gt;&gt;Site Settings&gt;&gt;Security&gt;&gt;New Role Assignment<br/><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Type 'JSBIAdmin' as Group or user name and select both roles (System Administrator and System User)</span>  <br/></span><span class="s2"><span class="s2"> <span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" width="600" src="attachments/42042453/55771338.png" data-image-src="attachments/42042453/55771338.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="55771338" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="10_40_125_48.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="42042453" data-linked-resource-container-version="50" alt=""></span><br/><br/><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Go to Home folder&gt;&gt;Folder Settings&gt;&gt;Security&gt;&gt;New Role Assignment<br/></span></span></span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Add JSBIAdmin Group/User Name and assign all but &quot;My Reports&quot; role <br/></span><p><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" width="600" src="attachments/42042453/52494488.png" data-image-src="attachments/42042453/52494488.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="52494488" data-linked-resource-version="3" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="QA_Server .png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="42042453" data-linked-resource-container-version="50" alt=""></span><br/><br/>Set the execution account in Reporting Services<br/>Open Reporting Services Configuration Manager, connect to the default instance and then from the left tab select execution Account<br/>Specify Account as localhost/JSBIAdmin, Password=Jigsaw1 <br/>or <br/>Suggested IT account<br/><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" width="600" src="attachments/42042453/54951969.png" data-image-src="attachments/42042453/54951969.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="54951969" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="211.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="42042453" data-linked-resource-container-version="50" alt=""></span> </p></li><li class="p1">Add JSBIAdmin to analysis server users<br/><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Connect to the Analysis Server, RMB the Server node and go to the properties&gt;&gt;Security and add JSBIAdmin as a new server role<span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" width="600" src="attachments/42042453/52494487.png" data-image-src="attachments/42042453/52494487.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="52494487" data-linked-resource-version="3" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="QA_Server.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="42042453" data-linked-resource-container-version="50" alt=""></span><br/></span> </li><li class="p1">Create the empty jmineops database with recovery model set to simple mode and replicate from postgresql production database</li><li class="p1">With the use of the xml_loader tool, load extensions to the sql master DB from the linux server (Library/jmineops/db/SQLServer/extensions.msql)</li><li class="p1">From the same SQLServer directory on the linux server, load all views to the jmineops sql database with the use of the xml_loader tool</li><li class="p1"><span class="s2">Run powershell as an administrator, then unblock powershell execution with the following.<br/></span><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">set-executionPolicy unrestricted</em><br/><br/><strong>Add the extended stored procedures dll and files to Program Files/Mineops</strong><br/><div>1. Check if you are running a 32 or 64 bit OS</div><div>     On your SQL Server go to:</div><div>     Start/All Programs/Accessories/System Tools/System Information</div><div>     <span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" width="600" src="attachments/42042453/52494515.png" data-image-src="attachments/42042453/52494515.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="52494515" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="SystemInformation.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="42042453" data-linked-resource-container-version="50" alt=""></span></div><p>2. Download <a class="external-link" href="http://10.7.0.9/Packages/win32/MSSQLProcs.zip%C2%A0" rel="nofollow">http://10.7.0.9/Packages/win32/MSSQLProcs.zip </a>;<br/>3. Unzip MSSQLProcs.zip  at C:\Program Files\<br/>4. If your OS is 32 bit skip this step:<br/>     Download <a class="external-link" href="http://10.7.0.9/Packages/win64/MSSQLProcs-1.dll" rel="nofollow">http://10.7.0.9/Packages/win64/MSSQLProcs-1.dll</a><strong><br/>      </strong>and replace the existent library in C:\Program Files\MineOPS\Jigsaw\Tools\<br/>5. Add a system environment variable:<br/>     Go to Start/ <br/>     Right click Computer/Properties/Advanced system settings<br/>     Click on the Environment Variables button <br/>     In the System Variable sections click New<br/>     Variable name: TZDIR<br/>     Variable Value: c:\Program Files\MineOPS\share\zoneinfo<br/>6. Find out the time zone the database is to report on:<br/>     In Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio <br/>     run the following query against your database <br/>     SELECT timezone FROM rotations<br/>     Example Output: Africa/Freetown<br/>7. Find the file specified by the output of step (6) which should be located under c:\Program Files\MineOPS\share\zoneinfo  e.g., \Africa\Freetown<br/>     Copy the appropriate file, in this example shown as (Freetown) and paste it in the folder c:\Program Files\MineOPS\share\zoneinfo and rename it to localtime<br/>8.  <span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">To test whether the dll files worked or not, execute the following script, if it returns some data, OK if NULL reconfigure time zones again<br/>   <span class="Apple-tab-span" style="line-height: 1.4285715;"> </span><span class="Apple-tab-span" style="line-height: 1.4285715;"> </span><span class="Apple-tab-span" style="line-height: 1.4285715;"> </span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">select * from dbo.ts_shift(getutcdate())<br/><br/></span></span></p></li></ul><p class="p1"><strong style="font-size: 20.0px;line-height: 1.5;"><span style="color: rgb(51,102,255);">2. BI - JSON Data Extension Installation &amp; User Guide</span></strong></p><h3 class="p1" id="JView-Overview"><strong style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Overview</strong></h3><p class="p1">Some of the reports developed by Jigsaw require a custom data source that was written to provide JSON data directly from JAMS objects. This is a C# library that converts the JSON data to a form that can be used by SSRS. <br/>This page gives instructions on how to install and use the extension.</p><h3 class="p2" id="JView-JAMSWebServiceSetupforNginx(LinuxServer)"><strong style="line-height: 1.4285715;">JAMS Web Service Setup for Nginx (Linux Server)<br/></strong></h3><p class="p2"><strong style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><em>Nginx Configuration</em></strong></p><p class="p1"><span class="s2">Nginx is a free, open-source, high-performance HTTP server that is used to power the web service for the JSBI JSON data extension to use. It must be configured to service the requests for object data. <br/></span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">If you've installed nginx from the server-i386.tar.bz2 or server-x86_64.tar.bz2 packages, nginx will already be installed in /opt/local/sbin.<br/></span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Perform the following steps for nginx setup on a new server:</span></p><ul><li class="p1"><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">$ sudo mkdir -p /etc/nginx</em></li><li class="p1"><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">$ sudo mkdir -p /var/log/nginx</em></li><li class="p1"><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">$ sudo mkdir -p /var/lib/nginx/body</em></li><li class="p1"><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">$ cd /etc/</em></li><li class="p1"><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">$ sudo tar xf nginx_cfg.bz2 (found at bpv)</em><br/><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><br/></span></li></ul><p class="p1"><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Then add the line &quot;user www-data www-data;&quot; to the top of the nginx.conf in /etc/nginx if it isn't already there. <br/></span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">By default the /opt/Jigsaw/Sources/Documentation/html directory is shared in the nginx.conf <br/></span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">You may want to change this to something you can test with if you don't already have this directory. <br/></span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">For example, change the line root /opt/Jigsaw/Sources/Documentation/html ; to root /opt/Jigsaw/Clients/client/html;</span></p><ul><li class="p1"><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;"> </span><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">$ sudo /opt/Jigsaw/Services/nginx start</em></li></ul><p class="p1"><span class="s2">This will test the basic setup of nginx. You can then create a symlink to the Services script in /etc/init.d/ and register it.</span></p><ul><li class="p1"><span class="s2"> </span><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">$ cd /etc/init.d</em></li><li class="p1"><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">$ sudo ln -s /opt/Jigsaw/Services/nginx nginx</em></li><li class="p1"><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">$ sudo chmod +x /etc/init.d/nginx</em></li><li class="p1"><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">$ sudo /usr/sbin/update-rc.d -f nginx defaults</em></li><li class="p1"><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">You can then start nginx like you would any standard init.d service.</em></li><li class="p1"><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">$ sudo /etc/init.d/nginx start</em></li></ul><p class="p1"> </p><h3 class="p1" id="JView-JAMSConfiguration"><span class="s2"><strong><em>JAMS Configuration</em></strong></span></h3><p class="p1"><span class="s2"><strong><em><br/></em></strong></span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">The JAMS configuration file xxx.jams must have entries for the business intelligence bundle and the fastCGI module. The following entries are needed:</span></p><p class="p1"><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;"> </span><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">[bundle JBusinessIntelligence]<br/></em><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">[fastCGI port=localhost:5000]<br/></em><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">The port number can be any unused port, but must be the same as what is setup in the /etc/nginx/nginx.conf file for the fastcgi_pass parameter. (In the entry above port 5000 is used)</span></p><h3 class="p1" id="JView-Nginx/JSONtesting"><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;"> </span><strong style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><em>Nginx/JSON testing</em></strong></h3><p class="p1"><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">If the text based browser lynx is installed (sudo aptitude install lynx) or you can connect from the network over 8080 to the JAMS server, try the following to test if nginx is now running:</span></p><ul><li style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">$ lynx localhost:8080</em></li></ul><p class="p1"><span class="s2">This should show either your index page, or a 403 forbidden if you have not set one up.<br/></span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">To then test the JSON interface try:</span></p><ul><li style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">$ lynx localhost:8080/jams/objects/Device</em></li></ul><p style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">or</span></p><ul><li style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">$ lynx localhost:8080/jams/objects/Equipment</em></li></ul><p class="p1"><span class="s2">This should then prompt you to download since browsers do not normally recognize the file type. The downloaded file should look similar to this:<br/></span><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">[{&quot;mac_address&quot;:null,&quot;device_type&quot;:null,&quot;utilities&quot;:null,&quot;id&quot;:1,&quot;software_version&quot;:null,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;APPLICATIONS&quot;,&quot;groups&quot;:null,</em><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">&quot;netmask&quot;:null,&quot;address&quot;:null,&quot;updated_at&quot;:&quot;2011-03-08 08:58:09&quot;,&quot;installed_version&quot;:null},...</em></p><p class="p1"><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><br/></em></p><h3 class="p1" id="JView-LibraryInstallation"><strong style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><em>Library Installation</em></strong></h3><p class="p1"><strong style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><em><br/></em></strong><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Downloadthe DLL zip file from the server location:<br/> </span>Go to <a class="external-link" href="http://hydra/Releases/TotalView2" rel="nofollow">http://hydra/Releases/TotalView2</a> and download the <span>&lt;release&gt;/</span>JSBIJAMSDataSource_&lt;release&gt;.zip from the appropriate release.<br/><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Right click and extract in the same folder and c</span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">opy the DLL to C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\MSRS12.MSSQLSERVER\Reporting Services\ReportServer\bin. </span></p><p class="p1">If this is an update to the DLL then simply overwrite.</p><p><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><u><strong>IMP NOTE</strong></u>: It is a good idea to make the backup of the config files before you modify them (rsreportserver.config,rssrvpolicy.config)<br/></span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Add this to the </span><strong style="line-height: 1.4285715;">data section</strong><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;"> of the C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\MSRS12.MSSQLSERVER\Reporting Services\ReportServer\rsreportserver.config:</span></p><p><em><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">&lt;Extension Name=&quot;JAMS&quot; Type=&quot;Microsoft.Samples.ReportingServices.JAMSDataExtension.JAMSConnection,Microsoft.Samples.ReportingServices.JAMSDataExtension&quot;/&gt;</span></em></p><p class="p1"><em><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;"> </span></em><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Add this entry in the C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\MSRS12.MSSQLSERVER\Reporting Services\ReportServer\rssrvpolicy.config. Use this entry as the last group in CodeGroup:<br/></span><em><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><br/>&lt;CodeGroup class=&quot;UnionCodeGroup&quot;</span></em></p><p class="p2"><em>      version=&quot;1&quot;</em></p><p class="p1"><em><span class="s2">      PermissionSetName=&quot;FullTrust&quot;<br/></span></em><em style="font-size: 14.0px;line-height: 1.4285715;"><span class="s2">      Name=&quot;JAMSCodeGroup&quot;</span></em></p><p class="p1"><em><span class="s2">      Description=&quot;Code group for my JAMS data processing extension&quot;&gt;</span></em></p><p class="p1"><em><span class="s2">      &lt;IMembershipCondition</span></em></p><p class="p1"><em><span class="s2">              class=&quot;UrlMembershipCondition&quot;</span></em></p><p class="p1"><em><span class="s2">              version=&quot;1&quot;</span></em></p><p class="p1"><em><span class="s2">              </span></em>Url=&quot;C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\MSRS12.MSSQLSERVER\Reporting Services\ReportServer\bin\Microsoft.Samples.ReportingServices.JAMSDataExtension.dll&quot;</p><p class="p1"><em><span class="s2"> </span></em><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">      /&gt;</em></p><p class="p2">&lt;/CodeGroup&gt;<br/><br/><strong style="line-height: 1.4285715;">NOTE:</strong><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;"> P</span><em style="line-height: 1.4285715;">lease verify the Url to the DLL is correct by copy pasting the above path into explorer. On some systems the SQL server reporting services may be installed on a drive other than the C: drive. Also on 64 bit installations with a 32 bit version of the report server would be in &quot;Program Files x(86)&quot; instead of &quot;Program Files&quot;. Alter the URL if necessary to the appropriate path.</em></p><p class="p2"><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Then change this part of the same file (rssrvpolicy.config):</span></p><p class="p2"><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;"> </span><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">                        &lt;CodeGroup </span></p><p class="p1"><span class="s2">                            class=&quot;FirstMatchCodeGroup&quot;</span></p><p class="p1"><span class="s2">                            version=&quot;1&quot;</span></p><p class="p1"><span class="s2">                            PermissionSetName=&quot;Nothing&quot;&gt;</span></p><p class="p1"><span class="s2">                        &lt;IMembershipCondition </span></p><p class="p1"><span class="s2">                                class=&quot;AllMembershipCondition&quot;</span></p><p class="p1"><span class="s2">                                version=&quot;1&quot;</span></p><p class="p1"><span class="s2">                        /&gt;</span></p><p class="p2">by substituting <strong style="line-height: 1.4285715;">PermissionSetName=&quot;Nothing&quot;</strong> with <strong style="line-height: 1.4285715;">PermissionSetName=&quot;FullTrust&quot;</strong></p><p class="p2"><strong style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><br/></strong></p><h2 class="p2" id="JView-3.BI-JViewandAdministrationUtilityInstallation"><strong style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><span style="color: rgb(51,102,255);">3. BI - JView and Administration Utility Installation</span> <span class="s1"><strong><span style="color: rgb(51,102,255);"> </span></strong></span><br/></strong></h2><p class="p2"><strong style="line-height: 1.4285715;">Overview</strong></p><p class="p1"><strong style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><br/></strong>These are the instructions for installing or updating JView and the JSBI administration tool.</p><p class="p1"><strong style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><em>Installation on the Target Server</em></strong></p><p class="p1"><strong style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><em><br/></em></strong><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">This section will describe how to install the web application on the target site.</span></p><h3 class="p1" id="JView-Pre-installationforFirstTimeInstall"><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;"> </span><strong style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><em>Pre-installation for First Time Install</em></strong></h3><p class="p1"><strong style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><em><br/></em></strong><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">The JView web application requires some additional software that is not usually installed on new target servers. Follow these steps to prepare the server to run the installer web application.</span></p><ul><li class="p1"><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">From Hydra <a class="external-link" href="http://10.7.0.9" rel="nofollow">http://Hydra</a> download the WebDeploy Tool - x64 found under Jview (TotalView 2) &gt; Extra Jview Related Windows Tool Installers section. </span></li><li class="p1">As an administrator, run the installer (select <strong>Typical</strong> if asked during installation) to add web deploy to the server.</li><li class="p1"><u><strong>IMP NOTE</strong></u>: Report Control Installer <u><strong>IS NOT REQUIRED</strong></u> for SQL Server 2014 (x64) on Windows Server 2012 R2 (x64).</li></ul><p class="p1"> </p><h3 id="JView-DisablingtheWebsite"><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);"><strong style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><em>Disabling the Website</em></strong></span></h3><p><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);">If this is an update to JView perform the following steps:</span></p><ul><li><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);"><span style="line-height: 1.42857;"> </span><span style="line-height: 1.42857;">Access the IIS7 management panel.</span></span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);">Navigate to the Default web site which is where the JView web application lives.</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);">Right click on the node and navigate to the Manage menu and click on Stop. The website is now not available.</span></li></ul><p><span style="color: rgb(255,0,0);"><br/></span></p><h3 class="p1" id="JView-InstallingthejViewWebApplication"><span class="s2"><strong><em>Installing the jView Web Application</em></strong></span></h3><ul><li class="p1"><p><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><span>From Hydra <a class="external-link" href="http://10.7.0.9" rel="nofollow">http://Hydra</a> </span>download the &lt;release&gt;/JSBIViewerInstaller_&lt;release&gt;.zip file.</span></p></li><li class="p1"><p>Extract all from the downloaded zip file. You can normally do this in the Documents directory of the account you are logged in with.</p></li><li class="p1"><p>Open the extracted folder then open the JSBIViewerParameters.SetParameters.xml file using notepad.</p></li><li class="p1"><p>Change the connection strings to the appropriate values for the installer command to use and save.</p></li><li class="p1"><p>Open a command window with the &quot;Run as Administrator&quot; option and change directories to the expanded installer files directory created above.</p></li><li class="p1"><p>Execute the command JSBIViewerPackage.deploy /t which executes the installer with a &quot;what if&quot; scenario. This will verify your database connection strings are valid.</p><p>If you get a connect error then go back and correct the mistakes in the connection strings and run the command again.</p></li><li class="p1"><p>After you verify the website deployment can finish without error run the command JSBIViewerPackage.deploy /y which will perform the installation (or update if the website was previously installed.)</p></li><li class="p1"><p>For first installations bring up the website and verify it's operational (Note at this point no BI Content has been added).</p></li><li class="p1"><p>If this is an update, bring the site back up with the following steps:</p></li></ul><ol><li style="list-style-type: none;background-image: none;"><ol><li class="p1"><p>Access the IIS7 management panel</p></li><li class="p1"><p>Navigate to the Default web site which is where the Jview web application lives</p></li><li class="p1"><p>Right click on the node and navigate to the Manage menu and click on start</p></li><li class="p1"><p>The website is now available (Note that current BI Content has not yet been upgraded at this point)</p></li></ol></li></ol><h3 class="p1" id="JView-InstallingtheJSBIAdminTool"><strong style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><em>Installing the JSBI Admin Tool</em></strong></h3><p class="p1"><strong style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><em><br/></em></strong><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;">The JSBI administration tool allows update/installation of the business intelligence artifacts that drive the JView web application. To install the tool perform the following steps.</span></p><ul><li class="p1"><span style="line-height: 1.4285715;"><span>From Hydra <a class="external-link" href="http://10.7.0.9" rel="nofollow">http://Hydra</a> </span>download the <span>&lt;release&gt;/</span>JSBIAdminToolInstaller_&lt;release&gt;.exe file.</span></li><li class="p1">If this is an update use the windows control panel to remove the current JSBIAdmin tool.</li><li class="p1">Change directories to the expanded installer files and execute the .exe file.</li><li class="p1">Follow the directions to install the application.</li></ul><p class="p1"> </p><h2 class="p1" id="JView-4.BI-JViewWebsiteArtifactInstallation"><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);"><strong><span style="color: rgb(51,102,255);">4. BI - JView Website Artifact Installation</span> <span class="s1"><strong><span style="color: rgb(51,102,255);"> </span></strong></span><br/></strong></span></h2><h3 class="p1" id="JView-Overview.1"><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);"><strong>Overview</strong></span></h3><p class="p1"><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);">These are the instructions for installing or updating JView report content and supporting artifacts using the JSBIAdmin tool. <br/>This tool updates standard artifacts including: Microsoft SQL Server database scripts (.sql files), Microsoft Analysis Server cube definitions and other XMLA files (.xmla files),<br/> Report Shared Data Sources (.rds files), Report Shared Data Sets (.rsd files), Reports (.rdl files) and Excel Analysis Spreadsheets (.xsls files)</span></p><p class="p1"><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);"><br/></span></p><h3 class="p1" id="JView-ReportArtifactInstallationSteps"><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);">Report Artifact Installation Steps</span></h3><ul><li><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);"> <span><span>From Hydra <a class="external-link" href="http://10.7.0.9" rel="nofollow">http://Hydra</a> </span>download the</span> <span>&lt;release&gt;/</span>JMineOPS_&lt;release&gt;.zip file of the Jview (TotalView 2) section</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);">Login as a local administrator (e.g., JSBIAdmin user), to the Windows server and copy the zip file to a place where you are allowed to copy files,<br/>usually the desktop is a good place for this file</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);">Right click on PowerShell and run as Administrator</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);">Execute the following command: set-executionPolicy unrestricted , then press enter</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);"> Type &quot;Y&quot; to confirm, then press enter</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);">Change directories to the location where your installer is located:<br/>cd C:\Program Files &lt;x86&gt;\HexagonMining\JSBIAdmin <br/></span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);">With the use of the JSBIAdmin installer deploy the artifacts to the ReportServer as shown in the following example; in fact this can be copied and edited for your use:</span><span class="s2"><em><br/>.\JSBIAdmin.exe -As localhost -Au JSBIAdmin -Ap Jigsaw1 -Ad ReportServer </em><em>-A &lt;Directory Path&gt;JMineOPS_&lt;release&gt;</em>.zip -Wu JSBIAdmin -Wp Jigsaw1 -W <a class="external-link" href="http://localhost/ReportServer/" rel="nofollow">http://localhost/ReportServer/</a> -S localhost -Ju JSBIAdmin -Jp Jigsaw1 -Js localhost -Jd jmineops -JSONURL <a class="external-link" href="http://10.40.124.98:8080/jams/objects/" rel="nofollow">http://&lt;FloatingIP&gt;:8080/jams/objects/</a> -TVWebApplicationRoot C:\inetpub\wwwroot\JView</span></li><li><span class="s2">Repeat these steps as necessary (i.e., For as many bundles as required) , Note that due to some dependencies the JMineOPS Standard bundle must always be deployed before any other bundles</span><br/><span class="s2"> </span></li></ul><h3 class="p1" id="JView-JSBIAdmininstallerargumentdescription:"><span class="s2">JSBIAdmin installer argument description:</span></h3><p><span class="s2"><br/></span></p><ul><li class="p1"><span class="s2">[-S  Analysis server host name (defaults to localhost)]</span></li><li class="p1"><span class="s2">[-d Analysis server database  (defaults to jmineops)]</span></li><li class="p1"><span class="s2">[-As SQL server host name (defaults to localhost)]</span></li><li class="p1"><span class="s2">[-Au SQL Server user name (defaults to JSBIAdmin)]</span></li><li class="p1"><span class="s2">-Ap SQL server password</span></li><li class="p1"><span class="s2">[-Ad Database for the report server on the SQL server (defaults to ReportServer)]</span></li><li class="p1"><span class="s2">[-A  Input Artifact ZIP file.  Defaults to C:\Users\JSBIAdmin\Documents\BI_JMineOps_1.057.zip ]</span></li><li class="p1"><span class="s2">[-W  Report server web service URL.  Defaults to <a class="external-link" href="http://localhost/ReportServer/" rel="nofollow">http://localhost/ReportServer/</a>]</span></li><li class="p1"><span class="s2">[-Wu Report server web service username. defaults to JSBIAdmin]</span></li><li class="p1"><span class="s2">-Wp Report server web service password</span></li><li class="p1"><span class="s2">[-Js Jmineops SQL server.  Defaults to localhost.]</span></li><li class="p1"><span class="s2">[-Ju Jmineops SQl server username. defaults to JSBIAdmin]</span></li><li class="p1"><span class="s2">[-Jd Jminops datbase on the SQL server.  Defaults to jmineops.]</span></li><li class="p1"><span class="s2">-JSONURL  URL to the JSON data service that serves JAMS data.</span></li><li class="p1"><span class="s2">[-TVWebApplicationRoot path to the Totalview web application.  Defaults to C:\inetpub\wwwroot\JView] <br/></span></li></ul></p></div></div><p><br/></p><p><br/></p>
                    </div>

                                        
                                                      
                </div>             </div> 
            <div id="footer" role="contentinfo">
                <section class="footer-body">
                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on dic 05, 2025 11:18</p>

        </div>     </body>
</html>

Lessons-Learnt_377570358.html


<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
    <head>
        <title>Product: MineOperate OP Pro : Lessons Learnt</title>
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles/site.css" type="text/css" />
        <META http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8">
    </head>

    <body class="theme-default aui-theme-default">
        <div id="page">
            <div id="main" class="aui-page-panel">
                <div id="main-header">
                    <div id="breadcrumb-section">
                        <ol id="breadcrumbs">
                            <li class="first">
                                <span><a href="index.html">Product: MineOperate OP Pro</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                    <li>
                                <span><a href="MineOperate-OP-Pro_224018004.html">MineOperate OP Pro</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                    <li>
                                <span><a href="Product-Support_254971960.html">Product Support</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                    <li>
                                <span><a href="2024-06-AMM-BIB-4.0-000-Critical-Escalations_347311125.html">2024-06 AMM BIB 4.0-000 Critical Escalations</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                    <li>
                                <span><a href="BIB-Stabilization---Hypercare-issues-status_350946985.html">BIB Stabilization - Hypercare issues status</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                </ol>
                    </div>
                    <h1 id="title-heading" class="pagetitle">
                                                <span id="title-text">
                            Product: MineOperate OP Pro : Lessons Learnt
                        </span>
                    </h1>
                </div>

                <div id="content" class="view">
                    <div class="page-metadata">
                        
        
    
    
        
    
        
        
            Created by <span class='author'> YEUNG Aaron</span>, last modified on feb 27, 2025
                        </div>
                    <div id="main-content" class="wiki-content group">
                    <div class="table-wrap"><table class="confluenceTable"><colgroup><col/><col/><col/><col/></colgroup><tbody><tr><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Lesson</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Notes</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh">Action</th><th scope="col" class="confluenceTh"><br/></th></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Need to have proper validation of software updates prior to deployment</p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Unvalidated patches cause the hyper care to be prolonged due to the constant cycle of fixing issues and causing other issues.</p><p>V1000s were delivered under extenuating circumstances and is a once off event.</p><p>Insufficient testing for V1000 hardware. PD do significantly more testing on the new display X hardware which is being field trialled</p></td><td class="confluenceTd">Develop more realistic environment for better stress testing</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Consider fleet size and duration to deploy updates to a large fleet</p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Results in clashes between software release</p><p>Causes confusion</p><p><br/></p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Create a hyper care standard to work with customer to nominate x% of equipment dedicated to field trialling patches.</p><p><br/>Facilitates change management</p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Timing of initiation of hyper care</p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Typically initiated too late. Usually when customer makes a threat</p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Introduce criteria for hyper care initiation???</p><p>Time a critical case is in hypercare (e.g. 26 weeks)</p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Reported issues do not have enough clarity (e.g. understanding what is a blank screen issue, </p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Waste time deciphering what an issue is or working on the wrong issue</p><p><br/></p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Request for videos (preferred), screenshots for tickets in hyper care</p><p>Additional training for support team to request for more details</p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Need for BU travel to site/timing of BU travel to site</p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Part of it is a PR exercise especially when the travel is late in the hyper care</p><p>Expedite communications and resolution</p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Introduce structure to BU travel:</p><ul style="list-style-type: square;"><li>Send GT first and/or application engineer</li><li>Standardized plan for BU at site (expedited change management, detailed schedule an plan of issues to be addressed)<ul style="list-style-type: square;"><li>Additional remote support from PD (afterhours if required)</li></ul></li></ul></td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Improve coordination amongst teams</p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p><br/></p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Assign single point of contact in each team</p><p>Re-use some of the process to log and report individual issues.</p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr></tbody></table></div><p><br/></p>
                    </div>

                                        
                                                      
                </div>             </div> 
            <div id="footer" role="contentinfo">
                <section class="footer-body">
                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on dic 05, 2025 11:19</p>
                    <div id="footer-logo"><a href="https://www.atlassian.com/">Atlassian</a></div>
                </section>
            </div>
        </div>     </body>
</html>





MineOperate-OP-Pro_224018004.html


<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
    <head>
        <title>Product: MineOperate OP Pro : MineOperate OP Pro</title>
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles/site.css" type="text/css" />
        <META http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8">
    </head>

    <body class="theme-default aui-theme-default">
        <div id="page">
            <div id="main" class="aui-page-panel">
                <div id="main-header">
                    <div id="breadcrumb-section">
                        <ol id="breadcrumbs">
                            <li class="first">
                                <span><a href="index.html">Product: MineOperate OP Pro</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                </ol>
                    </div>
                    <h1 id="title-heading" class="pagetitle">
                                                    <img src="images/icons/contenttypes/home_page_16.png" height="16" width="16" border="0" align="absmiddle" alt="Home Page" style="float: none; vertical-align: middle;"/>
                                                <span id="title-text">
                            Product: MineOperate OP Pro : MineOperate OP Pro
                        </span>
                    </h1>
                </div>

                <div id="content" class="view">
                    <div class="page-metadata">
                        
        
    
    
        
    
        
        
            Created by <span class='author'> MILAGRES Julia</span>, last modified by <span class='editor'> SEPULVEDA Edgar</span> on ago 16, 2022
                        </div>
                    <div id="main-content" class="wiki-content group">
                    <div class="contentLayout2">
<div class="columnLayout single" data-layout="single">
<div class="cell normal" data-type="normal">
<div class="innerCell">
<p>This space is for content related to the MineOperate OP Pro Product.</p><p><br/></p><div class='plugin-tabmeta-details'><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped relative-table confluenceTable" style="width: 37.3043%;"><colgroup><col style="width: 26.2763%;"/><col style="width: 73.7237%;"/></colgroup><tbody><tr><td class="highlight-grey confluenceTd" data-highlight-colour="grey" style="text-align: right;"><h2 id="MineOperateOPPro-Product">Product</h2></td><td class="confluenceTd"><h2 id="MineOperateOPPro-OPPro">OP Pro</h2></td></tr><tr><td class="highlight-grey confluenceTd" data-highlight-colour="grey" style="text-align: right;"><h2 id="MineOperateOPPro-ProductManager">Product Manager</h2></td><td class="confluenceTd"><h2 id="MineOperateOPPro-NathanGeorge,OPProLP"><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);">Nathan George, OP Pro LP</span></h2><h2 id="MineOperateOPPro-JohnNielsen,OPProHP"><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);">John Nielsen, OP Pro HP</span></h2></td></tr></tbody></table></div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="columnLayout two-equal" data-layout="two-equal">
<div class="cell normal" data-type="normal">
<div class="innerCell">
<h2 id="MineOperateOPPro-Announcements">Announcements</h2><p>General Availability: <a href="OP-Pro-3.0_231785728.html">OP Pro 3.0</a></p></div>
</div>
<div class="cell normal" data-type="normal">
<div class="innerCell">
<p><br/></p></div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="columnLayout two-equal" data-layout="two-equal">
<div class="cell normal" data-type="normal">
<div class="innerCell">
<p><br/></p><p><br/></p><p><br/></p><p><br/></p><p><br/></p><p><br/></p></div>
</div>
<div class="cell normal" data-type="normal">
<div class="innerCell">
<p><br/></p></div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="columnLayout two-equal" data-layout="two-equal">
<div class="cell normal" data-type="normal">
<div class="innerCell">
<h2 id="MineOperateOPPro-Recentspaceactivity">Recent space activity</h2><p>    

<div class="recently-updated recently-updated-social" >
            <div class="hidden parameters">

                                                <span id="title-text">
                            Product: MineOperate OP Pro : OP Pro 3.0 Architecture
