    </span>
</p></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Onboard Panel</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Web panel, OP Pro Plugin</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Activities</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">3.0 and above</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Activity Notification</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Allows the notification period for a Activity override notification to be specified</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable" data-mce-resize="false"><tbody><tr><th class="confluenceTh">module</th><th class="confluenceTh">attribute</th><th class="confluenceTh">value</th><th class="confluenceTh">application</th></tr><tr><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">activity_notification_seconds</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">60</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td></tr></tbody></table></div></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>
<span class="jira-issue lock-jira-issue MOPS-23044"
      data-jira-key="MOPS-23044" >
        <a class=issue-link" href="https://jira.hexagonmining.com/browse/MOPS-23044?src=confmacro">MOPS-23044</a>
        <span class="oauth-msg"> -
            <a class="static-oauth-init" href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/plugins/servlet/applinks/oauth/login-dance/authorize?applicationLinkID=ab53f6db-1037-3a9d-bb3c-d8ebd242d4b5">Autenticar</a> para ver datos del tique
        </span>
    </span>
</p></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Onboard Panel</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Web panel, OP Pro plugin</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Activities</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">3.0 and above</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Force Activity</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">The panel can be configured to force activity changes (i.e. tell JAMS to skip some exception checks) by setting the equipment_force_activity configuration to true.</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable" data-mce-resize="false"><tbody><tr><th class="confluenceTh">module</th><th class="confluenceTh">attribute</th><th class="confluenceTh">value</th><th class="confluenceTh">application</th></tr><tr><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">equipment_force_activity</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">true</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td></tr></tbody></table></div></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>
<span class="jira-issue lock-jira-issue MOPS-23044"
      data-jira-key="MOPS-23044" >
        <a class=issue-link" href="https://jira.hexagonmining.com/browse/MOPS-23044?src=confmacro">MOPS-23044</a>
        <span class="oauth-msg"> -
            <a class="static-oauth-init" href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/plugins/servlet/applinks/oauth/login-dance/authorize?applicationLinkID=ab53f6db-1037-3a9d-bb3c-d8ebd242d4b5">Autenticar</a> para ver datos del tique
        </span>
    </span>
</p></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Onboard Panel </td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Truck Panel</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Loading</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">2.8 and above</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Check Shovel is Loading</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Forces a truck to check that a shovel is loading, before changing truck to loading activity.</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable" data-mce-resize="false"><tbody><tr><th class="confluenceTh">module</th><th class="confluenceTh">attribute</th><th class="confluenceTh">value</th><th class="confluenceTh">application</th></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">action</td><td class="confluenceTd">loading_timeout</td><td class="confluenceTd">0</td><td class="confluenceTd">JAMS</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p>In the case shovel is not loading activity change would timeout and would return to the previous activity (traveling, waiting, spotting).  For this feature to work reliable network communications are required</p></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Onboard Panel</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Truck Panel</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Loading</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">2.05 and above</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Auto Loading on Departure</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);">When a truck does not have a payload sensor, prevents the activity from going from spotting to loading automatically and requires the operator to set loading manually</span></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable" data-mce-resize="false"><tbody><tr><th class="confluenceTh">module</th><th class="confluenceTh">attribute</th><th class="confluenceTh">value</th><th class="confluenceTh">application</th></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">action</td><td class="confluenceTd">auto_loading_on_departure</td><td class="confluenceTd">&lt;true/false&gt;</td><td class="confluenceTd">JAMS</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p><strong style="text-align: left;">Impact</strong><br style="text-align: left;"/><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);">Today the behavior of the system is to automatically change from spotting to loading, and this will continue to happen when the auto_loading_on_departure configuration is set to value True or is not configured.</span><br style="text-align: left;"/><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);">When auto_loading_on_departure is set to False, the system will not change automatically from spotting to loading. This new behavior (value = false) is a required behavior when the mine does not have payload sensor and the operators are instructed to set the &quot;loading&quot; activity manually. This will prevent the system generating inconsistent records in the database.</span></p></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>
<span class="jira-issue lock-jira-issue MOPS-16957"
      data-jira-key="MOPS-16957" >
        <a class=issue-link" href="https://jira.hexagonmining.com/browse/MOPS-16957?src=confmacro">MOPS-16957</a>
        <span class="oauth-msg"> -
            <a class="static-oauth-init" href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/plugins/servlet/applinks/oauth/login-dance/authorize?applicationLinkID=ab53f6db-1037-3a9d-bb3c-d8ebd242d4b5">Autenticar</a> para ver datos del tique
        </span>
    </span>
</p></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">System</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">OP Pro Manager</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Loading</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">2.06 and above</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Capture static payload</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">The static_payload field will be added to the ShiftLoad that will contain the last value received from the dipper sensor.<br/>Your value will be updated when the equipment is in the loading activity. When there is a change from loading activity<br/>to hauling the value will be stored on the ShiftLoad.</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable" data-mce-resize="false"><tbody><tr><th class="confluenceTh">module</th><th class="confluenceTh">attribute</th><th class="confluenceTh">value</th><th class="confluenceTh">application</th></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">shift_load_view</td><td class="confluenceTd">init</td><td class="confluenceTd">..... ,static_payload:ro ...</td><td class="confluenceTd">jminegraph</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p>The staticpayload field is added to the Shift Load view and will contain the last value received from the dipper sensor. When there is a change from loading activity to hauling the static payload value will be stored in the Shift Load view.</p><p><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);">ALTER TABLE shift_loads ADD static_payload real;</span></p></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>

      data-jira-key="MOPS-18059" >

</p></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Onboard Panel</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Truck Panel</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Loading</td><td colspan="1" 777E trucks</a></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable" data-mce-resize="false"><tbody><tr><th class="confluenceTh">module</th><th shock</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);">Configuration is now available to ensure shift buckets are only created in response to OEM shift bucket events.</span><br/><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);">Scope of changes should be limited to introducing an optional flag that allows bypassing the creation of shift_bucket in response to a shock event.</span></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable" data-mce-resize="false"><tbody><tr><th class="confluenceTh">module</th><th class="confluenceTh">attribute</th><th class="confluenceTh">value</th><th class="confluenceTh">application</th></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">action</td><td class="confluenceTd">disable_create_bucket_shock</td><td class="confluenceTd">&lt;true/false&gt;</td><td class="confluenceTd">JAMS</td></tr></tbody></table></div></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>
<span class="jira-issue lock-jira-issue MOPS-12988"
      data-jira-key="MOPS-12988" >
        <a class=issue-link" href="https://jira.hexagonmining.com/browse/MOPS-12988?src=confmacro">MOPS-12988</a>
        <span class="oauth-msg"> -
            <a class="static-oauth-init" href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/plugins/servlet/applinks/oauth/login-dance/authorize?applicationLinkID=ab53f6db-1037-3a9d-bb3c-d8ebd242d4b5">Autenticar</a> para ver datos del tique
        </span>
    </span>
</p></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Onboard Panel</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">All Equipment Panels (Legacy)</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Logon</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">2.8 and above</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Show Login view after Log off</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);">A feature has been added to the on-board application JSPanel which can be enabled through configuration. When an operator logs off, the login keypad is now automatically shown to speed up the login process for the next operator. The </span><strong style="text-align: left;">logoff</strong><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);"><span> </span>can be either a manual logoff where the operator performs this action from the menu or it can be auto logoff made by the system. For example, when the operator changes status to DELAY (shift change). </span></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable" data-mce-resize="false"><tbody><tr><th class="confluenceTh">module</th><th class="confluenceTh">attribute</th><th class="confluenceTh">value</th><th class="confluenceTh">application</th></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">show_login_on_logoff</td><td class="confluenceTd">&lt;true/false&gt;</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td></tr></tbody></table></div></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>
<span class="jira-issue lock-jira-issue MOPS-22943"
      data-jira-key="MOPS-22943" >
        <a class=issue-link" href="https://jira.hexagonmining.com/browse/MOPS-22943?src=confmacro">MOPS-22943</a>
        <span class="oauth-msg"> -
            <a class="static-oauth-init" href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/plugins/servlet/applinks/oauth/login-dance/authorize?applicationLinkID=ab53f6db-1037-3a9d-bb3c-d8ebd242d4b5">Autenticar</a> para ver datos del tique
        </span>
    </span>
</p></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">System</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">OP Pro Manager</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Hauling</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">2.06 and above</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Allow zero distance shift hauls</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Allows shift haul records to be created when haul distance = 0.  This will mainly happen when there is no route between the load location and the dump location.</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable" data-mce-resize="false"><tbody><tr><th class="confluenceTh">module</th><th class="confluenceTh">attribute</th><th class="confluenceTh">value</th><th class="confluenceTh">application</th></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">action</td><td class="confluenceTd">allow_zero_distance_shift_hauls</td><td class="confluenceTd">&lt;true/false&gt;</td><td class="confluenceTd">JAMS</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p><strong>Limitations</strong><br/><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);">Distance is still not calculated when no roads are defined</span></p></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>
<span class="jira-issue lock-jira-issue MOPS-19532"
      data-jira-key="MOPS-19532" >
        <a class=issue-link" href="https://jira.hexagonmining.com/browse/MOPS-19532?src=confmacro">MOPS-19532</a>
        <span class="oauth-msg"> -
            <a class="static-oauth-init" href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/plugins/servlet/applinks/oauth/login-dance/authorize?applicationLinkID=ab53f6db-1037-3a9d-bb3c-d8ebd242d4b5">Autenticar</a> para ver datos del tique
        </span>
    </span>
</p></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Office Application</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">OP Pro Manager</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">UI/UX</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">3.x</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Enable/Disable MDI Interface</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Enables/Disable the new MDI interface</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable" data-mce-resize="false"><tbody><tr><th class="confluenceTh">module</th><th class="confluenceTh">attribute</th><th class="confluenceTh">value</th><th class="confluenceTh">application</th></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jminegraph</td><td class="confluenceTd">use_mdi_interface</td><td class="confluenceTd">false</td><td class="confluenceTd">jminegraph</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p>In this case, the legacy UI would be enabled</p></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>
<span class="jira-issue lock-jira-issue MOPS-22501"
      data-jira-key="MOPS-22501" >
        <a class=issue-link" href="https://jira.hexagonmining.com/browse/MOPS-22501?src=confmacro">MOPS-22501</a>
        <span class="oauth-msg"> -
            <a class="static-oauth-init" href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/plugins/servlet/applinks/oauth/login-dance/authorize?applicationLinkID=ab53f6db-1037-3a9d-bb3c-d8ebd242d4b5">Autenticar</a> para ver datos del tique
        </span>
    </span>
</p></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Office Application</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">OP Pro Manager</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">UI/UX</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">3.x</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Enable/Disable MDI Main Menu</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Enables/Disables the use of the legacy menu system rather than the new Add Views button</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable" data-mce-resize="false"><tbody><tr><th class="confluenceTh">module</th><th class="confluenceTh">attribute</th><th class="confluenceTh">value</th><th class="confluenceTh">application</th></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jminegraph</td><td class="confluenceTd">enable_mdi_main_menu</td><td class="confluenceTd">true</td><td class="confluenceTd">jminegraph</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p>In the case, the legacy UI drop down menu system would be enabled</p></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>
<span class="jira-issue lock-jira-issue MOPS-22684"
      data-jira-key="MOPS-22684" >
        <a class=issue-link" href="https://jira.hexagonmining.com/browse/MOPS-22684?src=confmacro">MOPS-22684</a>
        <span class="oauth-msg"> -
            <a class="static-oauth-init" href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/plugins/servlet/applinks/oauth/login-dance/authorize?applicationLinkID=ab53f6db-1037-3a9d-bb3c-d8ebd242d4b5">Autenticar</a> para ver datos del tique
        </span>
    </span>
</p></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Onboard Panel</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">All Equipment Panels</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Fueling</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">2.7 and above</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Fuel Reason Codes</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Enables a list of reason codes to be specified that will trigger the fuel gauge to be reset when an equipment enters a fuel shop</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable" data-mce-resize="false"><tbody><tr><th class="confluenceTh">module</th><th class="confluenceTh">attribute</th><th class="confluenceTh">value</th><th class="confluenceTh">application</th></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">action</td><td class="confluenceTd">fuel_reason_codes</td><td class="confluenceTd">&lt;reason_code&gt;</td><td class="confluenceTd">JAMS</td></tr></tbody></table></div></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Onboard Panel</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Truck</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Fueling</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">2.8 and above</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Force fuel input after login</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><p>Operators will be prompted to enter fuel amount after refueling when Operator logs back into equipment.  The fuel prompt will only appear if the equipment is set to the refueling reason code.</p><p><strong style="text-align: left;">Note:</strong><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);"><span> </span>if the<span> </span></span><strong style="text-align: left;">force_manual_fuel_input</strong><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);"><span> </span>configuration is &quot;true&quot;, fuel input will be requested only once for each fueling process. If it's &quot;false&quot; (or the configuration doesn't exist), the fuel input will be requested at each login as long as the truck is in fueling reason.</span></p></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable" data-mce-resize="false"><tbody><tr><th class="confluenceTh">module</th><th class="confluenceTh">attribute</th><th class="confluenceTh">value</th><th class="confluenceTh">application</th><th colspan="1" class="confluenceTh">devices</th></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd"><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);">force_fuel_input_after_login</span></td><td class="confluenceTd">true</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">truck</td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">auto_delay_for_fueling</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">&lt;reason_code&gt;</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr></tbody></table></div></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>

      data-jira-key="MOPS-21394" >

</p></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Onboard Panel</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Truck</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Fueling</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">2.04 and above</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Force manual fuel input</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Prompt the operator to enter the fuel amount after the equipment has refueled and equipment status is changed to a ready code</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable" data-mce-resize="false"><tbody><tr><th class="confluenceTh">module</th><th class="confluenceTh">attribute</th><th class="confluenceTh">value</th><th class="confluenceTh">application</th><th class="confluenceTh">device</th></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">jspanel</td><td class="confluenceTd"><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);">force_manual_fuel_input</span></td><td class="confluenceTd">true</td><td class="confluenceTd">JSPanel</td><td class="confluenceTd">truck</td></tr></tbody></table></div></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p>

      data-jira-key="MOPS-17022" >

        <span class="oauth-msg"> -
            <a class="static-oauth-init" href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/plugins/servlet/applinks/oauth/login-dance/authorize?applicationLinkID=ab53f6db-1037-3a9d-bb3c-d8ebd242d4b5">Autenticar</a> para ver datos del tique

class="confluenceTd">2.7 and above</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd">Shovel Inactive Code</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><p>Set Trucks to delay when Shovel status is set to specified delay reason code (e.g. 240 - Wait on Shovel).</p><p>Trucks must be in Waiting, Spotting or Loading activity and assigned to Shovel.</p><p>When Shovel ready's up, Trucks in Delay will be set to Ready</p></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable" data-mce-resize="false"><tbody><tr><th class="confluenceTh">Module</th><th Debug</td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><p>Enable activity debug logging</p><p>After adding configuration add sensor_activity to the logger configuration to register the log in the event_logs table.</p></td><td colspan="1" class="confluenceTd"><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable" data-mce-resize="false"><tbody><tr><th class="confluenceTh">Module</th><th class="confluenceTd">Windows</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">MINSRVSQL26</td><td class="confluenceTd">10.1.0.7</td><td class="confluenceTd"><span style="color: rgb(50,49,48);">20.109.158.46</span></td><td class="confluenceTd"><span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);"> </span></td><td class="confluenceTd">Fleet Analytics 2.0 Beta</td><td class="confluenceTd">ETL/BI Database</td><td class="confluenceTd">Windows</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
                    </div>

                                        
                                                        <div class="pageSection group">
                        <div class="pageSectionHeader">
                            <h2 id="comments" class="pageSectionTitle">Comments:</h2>
                        </div>

                        <table border="0" width="100%">
                                                        <tr>
                                <td >
                                    <a name="comment-258820509"></a>

I did want to do it myself once I would like to confirm this information with you once seems the APERSRVAPP09 is used from ME team as well.</span></p><p><span style="color: rgb(0,0,0);">Or, should we install the OP Pro wrapper on <span style="color: rgb(23,43,77);">MINSRVSQL20? Just in case, I think make more sense on APERSRVAPP09 once it should have the MCT infrastructure already in place and it would be closer with the customer environment. </span></span></p></font>

Projects_226766399.html


<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
    <head>
        <title>Product: MineOperate OP Pro : Projects</title>
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles/site.css" type="text/css" />
        <META http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8">
    </head>

    <body class="theme-default aui-theme-default">
        <div id="page">

data-linked-resource-container-version="3">OAS-LV_ECN_010_NewCoverTop-BottomPlateChassis_Completed_Docusign.pdf</a></p><p></p><p></p></div></td><td><p>1.0</p><p></p></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p><u>This ECN supersedes the previously released OAS-LV_ECN_008</u>, which will be voided at the publishing of this ECN. The previous is recalled due to serious errors.</p><p><a href="attachments/347315808/347315816.docx" data-linked-resource-id="347315816" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="Failures-of_OAS-LV_ECN_008-ChassisChange.docx" data-nice-type="Word Document" data-linked-resource-content-type="application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document" data-linked-resource-container-id="347315808" data-linked-resource-container-version="3">Failures-of_OAS-LV_ECN_008-ChassisChange.docx</a></p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p></p><p></p><p>FatigueMonitor</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Internal</p><p></p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p></p><p></p><p>ECN - Engineering Change Notification</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p></p><p></p><p>Safety</p></div></td></tr><tr><td class="title" data-content-id="340034449"><a href="/display/MPub/VOIDED+OAS-LV_ECN_008+Changes+to+OAS-LV+Cover+Top+and+Bottom+Plate+Chassis">VOIDED OAS-LV_ECN_008 Changes to OAS-LV Cover Top and Bottom Plate Chassis</a></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p><strong><span style="color: rgb(255,0,0);">DO NOT USE.</span> This document has been voided. </strong></p><p><a href="attachments/340034449/340034444.pdf" data-linked-resource-id="340034444" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="OAS-LV_ECN_008-NewCoverTopAndBottomChassis_Rev1.pdf" data-nice-type="PDF Document" data-linked-resource-content-type="application/pdf" data-linked-resource-container-id="340034449" data-linked-resource-container-version="2">OAS-LV_ECN_008-NewCoverTopAndBottomChassis_Rev1.pdf</a></p><p></p><p></p></div></td><td><p>1.0 <span style="color: rgb(255,0,0);"><strong>VOIDED</strong></span></p></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Several changes to the design and fabrication of OAS-LV Cover Top, Bottom Plate Chassis, IR Window Lock, and screws have been identified to improve manufacturability. This includes changes to heat pad locations for improved adhesion, added cutouts for antenna positions, creating flat surfaces to adhere the antennas on, and removing side vents. Housing screws changed to one standardized type. </p><p><a href="attachments/340034449/340034448.pdf" data-linked-resource-id="340034448" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="OAS-LV_ECN_008-Approvals-Binder.pdf" data-nice-type="PDF Document" data-linked-resource-content-type="application/pdf" data-linked-resource-container-id="340034449" data-linked-resource-container-version="2">OAS-LV_ECN_008-Approvals-Binder.pdf</a></p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p></p><p></p><p>FatigueMonitor</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Internal</p><p></p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p></p><p></p><p>ECN - data to the MineEnterprise Protect Site Map and Analyze Dashboards.</p><p>CAS Analytics provides Clients with the ability to consolidate data from the onboard CAS units. Procedures</a></p></div></td><td><p>2020.05 (1.0.0)</p></td><td><p>The OAS Analytics Install and Upgrade Procedures summarize the steps a trained Hexagon Services team member takes to add the OAS Analytics Integration to MineEnterprise. The procedures include edits to the MineEnterprise Database Server, Application Server, and the jobs running on both servers to reconcile and correlate OAS with operations data.</p></td><td><div See the MineEnterprise Upgrade manual if a previous version of MineEnterprise is running.</p></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>HxGN MineEnterprise</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Internal</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Installation Manual</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Services</p></div></td></tr><tr><td class="title" data-content-id="204914209"><a href="/display/MPub/MineEnterprise+Upgrade+Manual">MineEnterprise Upgrade Manual</a></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper"><a class="confluence-embedded-file" href="/download/attachments/204914209/MineEnterprise_2020_05_3_6_1_Upgrade_Internal_A4_EN.pdf?version=2&amp;modificationDate=1591680896977&amp;api=v2" data-nice-type="PDF Document" data-file-src="/download/attachments/204914209/MineEnterprise_2020_05_3_6_1_Upgrade_Internal_A4_EN.pdf?version=2&amp;modificationDate=1591680896977&amp;api=v2" data-linked-resource-id="219836214" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-container-id="204914209" data-linked-resource-default-alias="MineEnterprise_2020_05_3_6_1_Upgrade_Internal_A4_EN.pdf" data-mime-type="application/pdf" data-has-thumbnail="true" data-linked-resource-version="2" data-can-edit="false" aria-label="MineEnterprise_2020_05_3_6_1_Upgrade_Internal_A4_EN.pdf" draggable="false"><img src="rest/documentConversion/latest/conversion/thumbnail/219836214/2" height="250" alt="" draggable="false"/></a></span></p><p><a class="external-link" href="https://minnet.hexagonmining.com/departments/product-management/Documents/Publications/Internal%20Use%20Only/MineEnterprise/MineEnterprise_Upgrade" rel="nofollow">Upgrade to MineEnterprise 2020.05 (3.6.1)</a></p></div></td><td><p>2020.05 (3.6.1)</p></td><td><p>Detailed steps for upgrading existing versions of MineEnterprise to a new version. Includes auditing servers, updates to licenses, and Windows settings.</p></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>HxGN MineEnterprise</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Internal</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Installation Manual</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Services</p></div></td></tr><tr><td class="title" data-content-id="209456074"><a href="/display/MPub/HxGN+MineOperate+Foundation+Haul+Operator+Reference">HxGN MineOperate Foundation Haul Operator Reference</a></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper"><a class="confluence-embedded-file" href="/download/attachments/209456074/MineOperate_Foundation_Haul_3_0_1-Operator_Reference_WIDE_EN.pdf?version=1&amp;modificationDate=1570592955531&amp;api=v2" data-nice-type="PDF Document" data-file-src="/download/attachments/209456074/MineOperate_Foundation_Haul_3_0_1-Operator_Reference_WIDE_EN.pdf?version=1&amp;modificationDate=1570592955531&amp;api=v2" data-linked-resource-id="209456091" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-container-id="209456074" data-linked-resource-default-alias="MineOperate_Foundation_Haul_3_0_1-Operator_Reference_WIDE_EN.pdf" data-mime-type="application/pdf" data-has-thumbnail="true" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-can-edit="false" aria-label="MineOperate_Foundation_Haul_3_0_1-Operator_Reference_WIDE_EN.pdf" draggable="false"><img src="rest/documentConversion/latest/conversion/thumbnail/209456091/1" height="150" alt="" draggable="false"/></a></span></p><p><a class="external-link" href="https://minnet.hexagonmining.com/departments/product-management/Documents/Publications/External/MineOperate%20Foundation/Haul" rel="nofollow">MineOperate Foundation Haul Operator Reference</a></p></div></td><td><p>3.0.1, 3.1.1</p></td><td><p>The MineOperate Foundation Haul app replaces entries in paper log books. Haul Truck Operators use and Android tablet to download in-pit source details, record work, and send the data to MineEnterprise.</p><p>The Operator Reference is added to the Android tablet. The document describes the core functions, buttons, and screens a Haul truck Operator uses. The reference is a supplement to the deployment training developed and delivered by the Services team.</p></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>HxGN MineOperate Foundation</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Internal</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>User Reference Manual</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Services</p></div></td></tr><tr><td The Internal Release Notes contain information for internal Services staff about new configuration or set up procedures.</p></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>HxGN MineOperate Foundation</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>External</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Release Notes</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Services</p></div></td></tr><tr><td class="title" data-content-id="219809264"><a href="/display/MPub/HxGN+MineOperate+Time+Operator+Guide">HxGN MineOperate Time Operator Guide</a></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper"><a class="confluence-embedded-file" href="/download/attachments/219809264/MineOperate_Foundation_Time_3_0_1_Operator_Reference_WIDE_EN.pdf?version=1&amp;modificationDate=1584517652127&amp;api=v2" data-nice-type="PDF Document" data-file-src="/download/attachments/219809264/MineOperate_Foundation_Time_3_0_1_Operator_Reference_WIDE_EN.pdf?version=1&amp;modificationDate=1584517652127&amp;api=v2" data-linked-resource-id="219809263" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-container-id="219809264" data-linked-resource-default-alias="MineOperate_Foundation_Time_3_0_1_Operator_Reference_WIDE_EN.pdf" data-mime-type="application/pdf" data-has-thumbnail="true" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-can-edit="false" aria-label="MineOperate_Foundation_Time_3_0_1_Operator_Reference_WIDE_EN.pdf" draggable="false"><img src="rest/documentConversion/latest/conversion/thumbnail/219809263/1" height="150" alt="" draggable="false"/></a></span></p><p>HxGN MineOperate Time Operator Guide</p></div></td><td><p>3.0.1</p></td><td><p>The MineOperate Foundation Time app allows mine site personnel with a variety of roles to log time from an Android app. The Time record tracks activity, duration, dates, and location data. The Time Operator Guide highlights the primary workflow and functions in the Time app.</p></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>HxGN MineOperate Foundation</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>External</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>User Reference Manual</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Services</p></div></td></tr><tr><td class="title" data-content-id="150323081"><a href="/display/MPub/AccuMine+%28JPS%29+Installation+Manual">AccuMine (JPS) Installation Manual</a></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p><a href="attachments/150323081/216290212.pdf" data-linked-resource-id="216290212" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="JPS_IM_en_A4_v3_1.pdf" data-nice-type="PDF Document" data-linked-resource-content-type="application/pdf" data-linked-resource-container-id="150323081" data-linked-resource-container-version="3">JPS_IM_en_A4_v3_1.pdf</a></p></div></td><td><br/></td><td><br/></td><td><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/JPS">AccuMine (JPS)</a></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Internal</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Installation Manual</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/TOPS">Operations</a></p></div></td></tr><tr><td class="title" data-content-id="216287798"><a href="/display/MPub/PL9+ECN+007">PL9 ECN 007</a></td><td><p><a href="attachments/216287798/216287797.pdf" data-linked-resource-id="216287797" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="PL9_ECN_007 - Foundation Haul Release Notes</span></a></p></div></td><td><p>3.1.0</p></td><td><p>The MineOperate Foundation Haul app replaces entries in paper log books. Haul Truck Operators use and Android tablet to download in-pit source details, record work, and send the data to MineEnterprise.</p><p>The Release Notes describe the new features, changes, and known issues with the Haul app.</p></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>HxGN MineOperate Foundation</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>External</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Release Notes</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Services</p></div></td></tr><tr><td class="title" data-content-id="216281185"><a class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper"><a class="confluence-embedded-file" href="/download/attachments/216281185/MineOperateFoundation_Beacon_v1_0_0_InitialRelease_External_A4_EN.pdf?version=1&amp;modificationDate=1580179653795&amp;api=v2" data-nice-type="PDF Document" data-file-src="/download/attachments/216281185/MineOperateFoundation_Beacon_v1_0_0_InitialRelease_External_A4_EN.pdf?version=1&amp;modificationDate=1580179653795&amp;api=v2" href="https://minnet.hexagonmining.com/departments/product-management/Documents/Publications/External/MineOperate%20Foundation/Beacon%20Scan" rel="nofollow">MineOperate Foundation Beacon Scan Release Notes</a></p></div></td><td><p>1.0.0</p></td><td><p>The Beacon Scan app is used by External Client IT to connect to Bluetooth beacons and map the Beacon to a Location ID. The Bluetooth beacon is used at underground and open pit in areas where network connectivity is poor. When Equipment running a MineOperate Foundation app detects the Bluetooth beacon, the Location is stored on the Equipment's app. The app will update the Locations when the Equipment moves into an area with network connectivity.</p></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>HxGN MineOperate Foundation</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>External</p></div></td><td><div run by the Client's IT. <span>The Client IT scans Bluetooth Beacons and maps the beacons to Locations with poor network coverage. </span>This manual describes how to install the Android app and to height="250" alt="" draggable="false"/></a></span></p><p><a class="external-link" rel="nofollow">MineEnterprise Asset Health Analytics Installation</a></p></div></td><td><p>3.4.0</p></td><td><p>The Asset Health Analytics Module is a module inside the MineEnterprise Platform. The Site Map and Dashboards communicate the Equipment conditions, such as fuel levels and hydraulic temperatures, and the Location of the Equipment at the time of capturing Equipment health data.</p></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>HxGN MineEnterprise</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Internal</p></div></td><td><div class="content-wrapper"><p>Installation <div class="tf-body-storage" id="body-storage-1468978334332_340265074-140642135--1810071624" style="display: none;"
     data-macro-id="1468978334332_340265074"

     data-session-id="-1810071624"

     data-is-email="$isEmail"
     data-params="{&quot;inverse&quot;:&quot;false%2Cfalse%2Cfalse%2Cfalse%2Cfalse%2Cfalse%2Cfalse%2Cfalse&quot;,&quot;ddSeparator&quot;:&quot;%E2%80%9A%E2%80%9A%E2%80%9A%E2%80%9A&quot;,&quot;sparkName&quot;:&quot;Sparkline&quot;,&quot;column&quot;:&quot;Product%2CType%2CGroup%2CVersion%2CPublication&quot;,&quot;hidePane&quot;:&quot;Filtration%20panel&quot;,&quot;separator&quot;:&quot;Point%20(.)&quot;,&quot;labels&quot;:&quot;Product%E2%80%9AType%E2%80%9AGroup%E2%80%9AVersion%E2%80%9APublication%E2%80%9APublication%E2%80%9ALink%E2%80%9AInformation&quot;,&quot;default&quot;:&quot;%2C%2C%2C%2C%2C%2C%2C&quot;,&quot;ddOperator&quot;:&quot;%2COR%2COR%2COR%2COR&quot;,&quot;cell-width&quot;:&quot;150%2C150%2C150%2C150%2C150%2C150%2C150%2C150&quot;,&quot;userfilter&quot;:&quot;Publication%2CLink%2CInformation&quot;,&quot;datepattern&quot;:&quot;yy-mm-dd&quot;,&quot;hideFilters&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;1468978334332_340265074&quot;,&quot;order&quot;:&quot;0%2C1%2C2%2C3%2C4%2C5%2C6%2C7&quot;}">
</div>

<script type="text/javascript" id="tf-init-script-1468978334332_340265074-140642135--1810071624">
    (function() {
        function start($) {
            AJS.toInit(function() {
                $ = window.$ || $;
                const script = $('#tf-init-script-1468978334332_340265074-140642135--1810071624');
                if ("Filtration panel" !== "true") {
                    script.parents(".panel, .alertPanel, .infoPanel, .innerCell").css("overflow", "visible");
                }
                script.remove();
                const init = function() {
                  TableFilterUtils.renderPanels($);
                  const tf = new TableFilter({
                        showNRows: "",
                        showNRowsifNotFiltered: "",
                        rowsPerPage: "",
                        ignoreFirstNrows: "",
                        limitHeight: "",
                        heightValue: "",
                        numbering: "",
                        sorts: [],
                        datepattern: TableUtils.unescapeString("yy-mm-dd"),
                        separator: ".",
                        id: "1468978334332_340265074",
                        pageId: "140642135",
                        sparkline: false,
                        sparkName: TableUtils.unescapeString("Sparkline"),
                        order: "0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7",
                        isOR: "AND",
                        ddSeparator: TableUtils.unescapeString("‚‚‚‚"),
                        ddSeparators: "",
                        ddOperator: ",OR,OR,OR,OR",
                        fixedCols: "",
                        totalrow: "",
                        totalcol: "",
                        isLockEnabled: false,
                        worklog: "",
                        updateSelectOptions: false,
                        totalColName: TableUtils.unescapeString(""),
                        totalRowName: TableUtils.unescapeString(""),
                        thousandSeparator: TableUtils.unescapeString(""),
                        tabs: false,
                        sessionId: -1810071624,
                        hidePane: "Filtration panel",
                        customNoTableMsg: false,
                        customNoTableMsgText: TableUtils.unescapeString(""),
                    });

                    if (tf == null) return;

                    $('.tablefilter-outer-wrapper[data-id="1468978334332_340265074"][data-pageid="140642135"][data-sessionid="-1810071624"]').attr("init-done", "true");

                    if ($("div.wiki-content.view-template").length) {
                        tf.comboBoxDiv.find("button").removeAttr("aria-disabled");
                        tf.saveBtn.remove();
                    }
                };

                var check = function() {
                    if (window.TableFilter) {
                        init();
                        $('.tablefilter-outer-wrapper[data-id="1468978334332_340265074"][data-pageid="140642135"][data-sessionid="-1810071624"] #comboBoxDiv-1468978334332_340265074').show();
                    } else {
                        $('.tablefilter-outer-wrapper[data-id="1468978334332_340265074"][data-pageid="140642135"][data-sessionid="-1810071624"] #comboBoxDiv-1468978334332_340265074').hide();
                        WRM.require("wrc!com.stiltsoft.confluence.tablefilter-resources", function() {
                            check();
                        });
                    }
                };

                check();
            });

        }

        if (document.readyState === "loading") {
            document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() {
                start(AJS.$);
            });
        } else {
            start(AJS.$);
        }
    })();
</script></p>
                    </div>

                                        
                                                      
                </div>             </div> 
            <div id="footer" role="contentinfo">
                <section class="footer-body">
                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on dic 05, 2025 11:18</p>
                    <div id="footer-logo"><a href="https://www.atlassian.com/">Atlassian</a></div>
                </section>
            </div>
        </div>     </body>
</html>

Release-Management-Strategy_231786292.html


<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
    <head>
        <title>Product: MineOperate OP Pro : Release Management Strategy</title>
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles/site.css" type="text/css" />
        <META http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8">
    </head>

    <body class="theme-default aui-theme-default">
        <div id="page">
            <div id="main" class="aui-page-panel">
                <div id="main-header">
                    <div id="breadcrumb-section">
                        <ol id="breadcrumbs">
                            <li class="first">
                                <span><a href="index.html">Product: MineOperate OP Pro</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                    <li>
                                <span><a href="MineOperate-OP-Pro_224018004.html">MineOperate OP Pro</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                    <li>
                                <span><a href="Product-Releases_228590211.html">Product Releases</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                    <li>
                                <span><a href="OP-Pro-3.0_231785728.html">OP Pro 3.0</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                </ol>
                    </div>
                    <h1 id="title-heading" class="pagetitle">
                                                <span id="title-text">
                            Product: MineOperate OP Pro : Release Management Strategy
                        </span>
                    </h1>
                </div>

                <div id="content" class="view">
                    <div class="page-metadata">
                        
        
    
    
        
    
        
        
            Created by <span class='author'> GEORGE Nathan</span> on feb 17, 2021
                        </div>
                    <div id="main-content" class="wiki-content group">
                    <p><h2 id="ReleaseManagementStrategy-ExternalStakeholders">External Stakeholders</h2><h3 id="ReleaseManagementStrategy-ExistingCustomers">Existing Customers</h3><h4 id="ReleaseManagementStrategy-CustomerUpgradePlan">Customer Upgrade Plan</h4><ul><li>OP Pro 3.0 Upgrade Strategy<ul><li>Work with regions to categorise customers into <br/><ul><li>Early Adoptors</li><li>Early Majority</li><li>Late Majority</li><li>Laggards</li></ul></li><li>Develop a prioritised customer upgrade list with tentative upgrade schedule for next 12-24 months for each region</li><li>Assess the upgrade plan in terms of available PM &amp; PD &amp; Services resources</li></ul></li></ul><h4 id="ReleaseManagementStrategy-CustomerUpgradeAssessment">Customer Upgrade Assessment</h4><ul><li>Onboard Panel Gap Analysis<ul><li>For each customer conduct an onboard panel gap analysis between their existing Truck &amp; Shovel panels V's the new OP Pro 3.0 Web Panels<ul><li>Identify customer screens, features, workflows that have been developed for the customer</li><li>Asses these gaps and conduct a MoSCoW prioritisation of the customer requirements<ul><li><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" height="250" src="attachments/224022317/224022303.png" data-image-src="attachments/224022317/224022303.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="224022303" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="image2020-7-21_17-58-29.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="224022317" data-linked-resource-container-version="4" alt=""></span></li></ul></li><li>Assess these requirements (MUST &amp; SHOULD) have and validate whether they will be included in the generic panel build</li><li>Services and Account Management should work with the customer to assess whether COULD and WILL NOT have requirements can be omitted or achieved by doing things differently or changing their process</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul><p><br/></p><ul><li>Onboard Panel Development<ul><li>Generally the process for new panel features will be<ul><li>Functional Requirements and Mock Up (App Eng &amp; PM)</li><li>UI/UX Design (UI/UX Team)</li><li>Epic creation (PM)</li><li>PD Estimate (PO)</li><li>PD Scheduling (PO/PM)</li><li>PD &amp; QA</li><li>FC</li><li>PR</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul><p>APAC</p><ul><li><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/PE/OP+Pro+Customisations">OP Pro Customisations</a></li></ul></p>
                    </div>

                                        
                                                      
                </div>             </div> 
            <div id="footer" role="contentinfo">
                <section class="footer-body">
                    <p>Document generated by Confluence on dic 05, 2025 11:18</p>
                    <div id="footer-logo"><a href="https://www.atlassian.com/">Atlassian</a></div>
                </section>
            </div>
        </div>     </body>
</html>

Supported-Equipment-Interfaces_231795188.html


<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
    <head>
        <title>Product: MineOperate OP Pro : Supported Equipment Interfaces</title>
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles/site.css" type="text/css" />
        <META http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8">
    </head>

    <body class="theme-default aui-theme-default">
        <div id="page">
            <div id="main" class="aui-page-panel">
                <div id="main-header">
                    <div id="breadcrumb-section">
                        <ol id="breadcrumbs">
                            <li class="first">
                                <span><a href="index.html">Product: MineOperate OP Pro</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                    <li>
                                <span><a href="MineOperate-OP-Pro_224018004.html">MineOperate OP Pro</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                    <li>
                                <span><a href="Product-Information_224018007.html">Product Information</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                </ol>
                    </div>
                    <h1 id="title-heading" class="pagetitle">
                                                <span id="title-text">
                            Product: MineOperate OP Pro : Supported Equipment Interfaces
                        </span>
                    </h1>
                </div>

                <div id="content" class="view">
                    <div class="page-metadata">
                        
        
    
    
        
    
        
        
            Created by <span class='author'> GEORGE Nathan</span> on mar 04, 2021
                        </div>
                    <div id="main-content" class="wiki-content group">
                    <p><div class="contentLayout2">
<div class="columnLayout single" data-layout="single">
<div class="cell normal" data-type="normal">
<div class="innerCell">
<p class="auto-cursor-target">For Asset Health support see below (contact <a class="confluence-userlink user-mention" data-username="SMRY" href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/~SMRY" data-linked-resource-id="172789989" data-linked-resource-version="2" data-linked-resource-type="userinfo" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com">SMITH Ryan</a> with any doubts):</p><p><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/MINH/Supported+Interfaces+Summary+-+Asset+Health">Supported Interfaces Summary - Asset Health</a></p><div class="confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-information"><span class="aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-info confluence-information-macro-icon"></span><div class="confluence-information-macro-body"><p>All documented Jigsaw OEM interfaces can be found on this page. The intent of this page is to clearly document interfaces that are available for sale and interfaces that are in development. Currently this is not clearly understood. However the page will be continually updated with new information as it becomes available. Once it is up to date this disclaimer will disappear.</p><p>Please contact <a class="confluence-userlink user-mention" data-username="ari" href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/~ari" data-linked-resource-id="31659702" data-linked-resource-version="3" data-linked-resource-type="userinfo" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com">Usuario desconocido (ari)</a> with any questions or clarifications required for interfaces.</p></div></div><div class="confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-note"><span class="aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-warning confluence-information-macro-icon"></span><div class="confluence-information-macro-body"><p>Due to hydra deactivation the files were moved to their respective OEM Interfaces pages and the links replaced. As you encounter broken links, please upload the file to the page where it belongs and update its link or report the issue.</p></div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="columnLayout single" data-layout="single">
<div class="cell normal" data-type="normal">
<div class="innerCell">

</div>

<div class="innerCell">
<h1 id="SupportedEquipmentInterfaces-CategorizedbyEquipmentTypeorFunction"><span class="mw-headline" style="color: rgb(0,0,0);">Categorized by Equipment Type or Function</span></h1><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable"><colgroup><col/><col/><col/><col/></colgroup><tbody><tr><th class="confluenceTh"><h2 id="SupportedEquipmentInterfaces-Generic">Generic</h2></th><th class="confluenceTh"><h2 id="SupportedEquipmentInterfaces-Truck">Truck</h2></th><th class="confluenceTh"><h2 id="SupportedEquipmentInterfaces-Shovel">Shovel</h2></th><th class="confluenceTh"><h2 id="SupportedEquipmentInterfaces-Drill">Drill</h2></th></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper">

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
    <head>
        <title>Product: MineOperate OP Pro : Truck cycling</title>

        <META http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8">
    </head>

    <body class="theme-default aui-theme-default">
        <div id="page">
            <div id="main" class="aui-page-panel">
                <div id="main-header">
                    <div id="breadcrumb-section">
                        <ol id="breadcrumbs">
                            <li class="first">
                                <span><a href="index.html">Product: MineOperate OP Pro</a></span>
                            </li>

                                <span><a href="MineOperate-OP-Pro_224018004.html">MineOperate OP Pro</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                    <li>
                                <span><a href="Product-Information_224018007.html">Product Information</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                    <li>
                                <span><a href="Onboard-Equipment-Panels_298713434.html">Onboard Equipment Panels</a></span>
                            </li>
                                                    <li>
                                <span><a href="Truck_280987119.html">Truck</a></span>
                            </li>

                    </div>
                    <h1 id="title-heading" class="pagetitle">
                                                <span id="title-text">
                            Product: MineOperate OP Pro : Truck cycling
                        </span>
                    </h1>
                </div>

                <div id="content" class="view">
                    <div class="page-metadata">
                        
        
    
    
        
    
        
        
            Created by <span class='author'> HOLDEN Anthony</span> on oct 11, 2022
                        </div>
                    <div id="main-content" class="wiki-content group">
                        
    

 
<div class="sp-macro-verticalNav" >
		<div class="aui-page-panel-nav sp-macro-verticalNav-items-panel">
	    <nav class="aui-navgroup aui-navgroup-vertical sp-verticalnav-header blue">
	        <div class="aui-navgroup-inner">
	         	<ul class="aui-nav blue  ">
	         					    				    	 					    	 	<li  class="  active-tab aui-nav-selected   blue">
				    	 		<a class="sp-nav-tabs-link selected-fip-icon-block" href="#1216219555">
								 	<span class="sp-nav-tabs-icon-container">
									 	<i class="custom-spectrum-button fip-icon-block"></i>
									</span>
									Configurations
								</a>
				    	 	</li>
				    	 				    	 				        			    	 					    	 	<li  class="   blue">
				    	 		<a class="sp-nav-tabs-link selected-fip-icon-block" href="#1023047616">
								 	<span class="sp-nav-tabs-icon-container">
									 	<i class="custom-spectrum-button fip-icon-block"></i>
									</span>
									Auto Haul Matrix
								</a>
				    	 	</li>
				    	 				    	 				        	            </ul>
	        </div>
	    </nav>

	</div>
 
    <section class="aui-page-panel-content sp-verticalNav-content   blue">
        <div class="aui-nav-selected sp-nav-item" data-title="spvnav280987129Configurations" id="1216219555">
	
		
	<div data-title="Configurationslinull" icon = "fip-icon-block" data-header ="null" id="1216219555">
		<p><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/MINH/Automatic+Haul+Cycle+Configurations">Automatic Haul Cycle Configurations</a></p><p>Automatic Haul Cycle Configurations<p><strong>See <a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/MINH/Auto+Haul+Matrix">Auto Haul Matrix</a> for specific sensor values</strong></p><p><strong>Intro</strong><br/>The purpose of this page is to outline how OEM interfaces are used to automatically change the activity of trucks during their haul cycle.<br/>It has been noted that regional offices use different methods to do this that may not be optimal as the standard setups have been designed to be used out of the box.</p><p><br/></p><p><strong>Overview</strong> <br/>OP Pro uses sensor types to designate sensors that will be used for integration purposes, whether that is a functional action or simply a data store.<br/>In case of Asset Health being integrated with OP Pro, there are base sensor types also called &quot;known sensors&quot; that share information to OP Pro by the same rules above.<br/>In OP Pro there is capability to use only GPS for all activity changes. This will work; however, it is not as accurate as the OEM interface. In OP Pro both methods can be enabled. It will use the OEM interface first and if that does not trigger the activity it will use GPS.</p><p><br/>There is also a configuration to set GPS distance to 0 for activities in order to force activity changes from the OEM sensor by itself. This however does not seem to be used as the redundancy of the two options together makes for a smoother transition. If the interface needs maintenance and is acting up the machine should still reliably cycle by GPS.</p><p><br/></p><p><strong>Note on gear mapping</strong><br/>It is worth noting that there is a configuration in OP Pro for VIMS called &quot;dynamic_gear_numbers&quot; which can be used to override the default values map for gear_position sensor for the interface. <br/>A values map is the raw value we receive from the interface vs the actual gear value. A default values map is already built into the interface configuration. If issues are seen with it, you can have an operator cycle gears in a specified order, read the sensor value, and correct the mapping or have site contact the OEM dealer for an updated values map for the machines running and add the configuration to the interface device in OP Pro.</p><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable"><colgroup><col/><col/><col/><col/></colgroup><tbody><tr><td class="confluenceTd"><p><span style="color: rgb(36,36,36);">module</span></p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p><span style="color: rgb(36,36,36);">application</span></p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p><span style="color: rgb(36,36,36);">attribute</span></p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p><span style="color: rgb(36,36,36);">value</span></p></td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd"><p><span style="color: rgb(36,36,36);">vims</span></p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p><span style="color: rgb(36,36,36);">JAMS</span></p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p><span style="color: rgb(36,36,36);">dynamic_gear_numbers</span></p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p><span style="color: rgb(36,36,36);">33=R;64=N;129=1;145=1;146=2;147=3;148=4;149=5;150=6;255=R;</span><span style="color: rgb(36,36,36);">8192=N;16385=1;16386=2;16387=3;16388=4;16389=5;</span> <span style="color: rgb(36,36,36);">16390=D;16391=D;16895=1;16896=2;16897=3;16898=4;</span> <span style="color: rgb(36,36,36);">16899=5;16900=6;16901=D;16902=D;16903=D</span></p></td></tr></tbody></table></div><p><br/></p><p><strong>Activity Changes</strong><br/>From the User Reference Manual, we see the following matrix:<br/><br/></p><p><span class="confluence-embedded-file-wrapper confluence-embedded-manual-size"><img class="confluence-embedded-image" draggable="false" width="600" src="attachments/274412886/274413001.png" data-image-src="attachments/274412886/274413001.png" data-unresolved-comment-count="0" data-linked-resource-id="274413001" data-linked-resource-version="1" data-linked-resource-type="attachment" data-linked-resource-default-alias="image2022-8-26_14-16-21.png" data-base-url="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com" data-linked-resource-content-type="image/png" data-linked-resource-container-id="274412886" data-linked-resource-container-version="18" alt=""></span></p><p><br/></p><p>The primary Activities are shown above:<br/><strong>Traveling &gt; Waiting at Shovel &gt; Spotting &gt; Loading &gt; Hauling &gt; Queuing at Dump &gt; Backing &gt; Tipping</strong><br/>Several of the Activities can be triggered by OEM interfaces or other input, outlined below the sensor type being used for activity transitions, by each interface.</p><p><br/></p><p><strong>Caterpillar Trucks - VIMS Std | VIMS3G</strong></p><ul><li>payload_status<ul><li>Traveling, Loading, Hauling, Tipping</li></ul></li><li>gear_position<ul><li>Spotting, Backing</li></ul></li><li>GPS<ul><li>Waiting at Shovel, Queuing at Dump</li></ul></li></ul><p>The VIMS interface uses a sensor called Payload Status/OHT Payload Status which offers different values for the haul state. We are using four of the payload state values to change the activity onboard. The gear sensor is also used for two activity changes of the main activity changes. Finally, the last two activities use GPS to determine when to change the activity.</p><p><br/></p><p><strong>Komatsu Trucks - (PLM2/3 | PLMIV) + VHMS (Komtrax Plus)</strong></p><ul><li>payload_status<ul><li>(Traveling, Loading, Hauling, Tipping)<strong>(PLMIV) | </strong> (Loading, Tipping) <strong>(PLM2/3)</strong></li></ul></li><li>gear_position <strong>(VHMS - not implemented for activity changes)</strong><ul><li>Spotting, Backing</li></ul></li><li>Tray Down <strong>(PLM2/3)</strong><ul><li>Traveling</li></ul></li><li>Final Payload <strong>(PLM2/3)</strong><ul><li>Hauling</li></ul></li><li> GPS<ul><li>Waiting at Shovel, Queuing at Dump</li></ul></li></ul><p>The PLMIV interface we are able to utilize Payload Status for four of the main activities. There isn't access to the gear position sensor in PLM, but it's counterpart VHMS (Komtrax Plus) includes it for potential use in Spotting and Backing activities, code has not been written to handle this.  In OP Pro PLM2/3 we use vehicle_status instead of payload_status in the code for the sensor type.  PLM2/3 use different sensors for Traveling and Hauling as shown above.</p><p><br/></p><p><strong>Hitachi Trucks - Hitachi5 | Hitachi7 (Note:  In recent tests of Hitachi trucks payload_status data received is not consistent and is removed in default config sheets for AH)</strong></p><ul><li>payload_status<ul><li>Traveling, Loading, Hauling, Tipping</li></ul></li><li>gear_position<ul><li>Spotting, Backing</li></ul></li><li>GPS<ul><li>Waiting at Shovel, Queuing at Dump</li></ul></li></ul><p>Hitachi interfaces have payload_status and gear_position sensors as well. There was some work done recently for Hitachi5 for HTM trucks that needs to be updated. Hitachi7 there is a known issue with gear sensor being sent as a string when deployed in Asset Health.</p><p><br/></p><p><strong>Liebherr Trucks - LiebherrCan/LiebherrPayload</strong></p><ul><li>LiebherrPayload sends events that trigger auto activity changes <strong>(Not confirmed to be used/working yet)</strong><ul><li>Traveling, Loading, Hauling, Tipping (does not use sensor_type/known_sensor)</li><li>GPS for Spotting, Backing, Waiting at Shovel, Queuing at Dump</li></ul></li></ul><p><br/></p><p><strong>Belaz Trucks</strong> <strong>- Belaz</strong></p><ul><li>gear_position<ul><li>Spotting, Backing</li></ul></li><li>dipper<ul><li>Loading</li></ul></li><li>body_lever<ul><li>Tipping</li></ul></li><li>GPS<ul><li>Traveling, Waiting, Hauling, Queued</li></ul></li></ul><p>Belaz interface does not provide a payload sensor to trigger hauling. Once hauling is detected through GPS, the last dipper value is set as payload.</p></p>
	</div>
</div>
<div class="sp-nav-item" data-title="spvnav280987129Auto--Haul--Matrix" id="1023047616">
	
		
	<div data-title="Auto--Haul--Matrixlinull" icon = "fip-icon-block" data-header ="null" id="1023047616">
		<p><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/MINH/Auto+Haul+Matrix">Auto Haul Matrix</a></p><p>Note GPS activity distances listed are a starting point, but may differ from site to site for optimal setting.  LiebherrPayload interface not verified to be used as the code suggests.  VHMS has gear_position functionality not implemented currently.<p>For gear_position sensor type, there can be different raw integer values that correspond to R (reverse) in a values map.  Gear position values used to activity changes are hardcoded in JInterface files for associated interfaces.</p><p><br/></p><p>Note that when using JHealthIntegration conversions are made for payload_status to general values:</p><div class="table-wrap"><table class="wrapped confluenceTable"><colgroup><col/><col/></colgroup><tbody><tr><td class="confluenceTd">JHealthIntegration payload_status sensor</td><td class="confluenceTd">Value</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">PayloadStatus_Traveling </td><td class="confluenceTd">1</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">PayloadStatus_Loading</td><td class="confluenceTd">2</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">PayloadStatus_Hauling</td><td class="confluenceTd">3</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">PayloadStatus_Tipping</td><td class="confluenceTd">4</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p>Example:  VIMS interface sends payload_status = 6 for Traveling activity, this would show as payload_status=1 for units loaded with Asset Health.  Functionally the business logic is the same.</p><p><br/></p><div class="table-wrap"><table class="relative-table wrapped confluenceTable" style="width: 93.6957%;"><colgroup><col style="width: 7.60392%;"/><col style="width: 23.9734%;"/><col style="width: 8.18431%;"/><col style="width: 8.41646%;"/><col style="width: 7.60392%;"/><col style="width: 7.60392%;"/><col style="width: 7.13962%;"/><col style="width: 7.60392%;"/><col style="width: 7.72%;"/><col style="width: 6.95009%;"/><col style="width: 7.20038%;"/></colgroup><tbody><tr><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd">Caterpillar</td><td colspan="3" class="confluenceTd">Komatsu</td><td colspan="2" class="confluenceTd">Hitachi <strong>(note:  payload_status is currently not consistent coming from Hitachi trucks, only enable to test)</strong></td><td class="confluenceTd">Liebherr</td><td class="confluenceTd">Belaz</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">Activity</td><td class="confluenceTd">Description</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd">VIMS Std + VIMS3G</td><td class="confluenceTd">PLMII PLMIII</td><td class="confluenceTd">PLMIV</td><td class="highlight-#ff7452 confluenceTd" data-highlight-colour="#ff7452" title="Background color : Medium red 85%">VHMS</td><td class="confluenceTd">Hitachi5</td><td class="confluenceTd">Hitachi7</td><td class="highlight-#ff7452 confluenceTd" data-highlight-colour="#ff7452" title="Background color : Medium red 85%">LiebherrPayload</td><td class="confluenceTd">Belaz</td></tr><tr><td colspan="2" class="confluenceTd">OP Pro Technical Reference</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd"><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/JOI/Vims#Vims-Installation" rel="nofollow">Vims</a></td><td class="confluenceTd"><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=50992821" rel="nofollow">PLMII PLMIII</a></td><td class="confluenceTd"><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/JOI/PLMIV" rel="nofollow">PLM IV</a></td><td class="highlight-#ff7452 confluenceTd" data-highlight-colour="#ff7452" title="Background color : Medium red 85%"><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/JOI/Vhms" rel="nofollow" title="">VHMS</a></td><td class="confluenceTd"><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/JOI/Hitachi+J1939" rel="nofollow">Hitachi5</a></td><td class="confluenceTd"><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/JOI/Hitachi+J1939" rel="nofollow">Hitachi7</a></td><td class="highlight-#ff7452 confluenceTd" data-highlight-colour="#ff7452" title="Background color : Medium red 85%"><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/JOI/Liebherr+Payload" rel="nofollow" title="">LiebherrPayload</a></td><td class="confluenceTd"><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/JOI/Belaz" rel="nofollow">Belaz</a></td></tr><tr><td rowspan="2" class="confluenceTd">Travelling</td><td rowspan="2" class="confluenceTd">Truck is moving empty after dumping.</td><td rowspan="2" class="confluenceTd"><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/CEA/Travelling" rel="nofollow">Travelling</a></td><td class="confluenceTd">payload_status=6</td><td class="confluenceTd">Tray Down (if trayup_tipping config enabled</td><td class="confluenceTd">payload_status=8</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd">payload_status=7</td><td class="confluenceTd">payload_status=E</td><td class="highlight-#ff7452 confluenceTd" data-highlight-colour="#ff7452" title="Background color : Medium red 85%">LME_EMPTY?</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr><tr><td colspan="8" style="text-align: center;" class="confluenceTd">GPS. moves departure_distance ~ 50</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">Waiting at shovel</td><td class="confluenceTd">Truck is waiting to be loaded near the shovel.</td><td class="confluenceTd"><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/CEA/Waiting" rel="nofollow">Waiting</a></td><td colspan="8" style="text-align: center;" class="confluenceTd">GPS. Stopped within waiting_distance ~ 100</td></tr><tr><td rowspan="2" class="confluenceTd">Spotting</td><td rowspan="2" class="confluenceTd">Truck is positioning under the shovel.</td><td rowspan="2" class="confluenceTd"><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/CEA/Spotting" rel="nofollow">Spotting</a></td><td class="confluenceTd">gear_position=R</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="highlight-#ff7452 confluenceTd" data-highlight-colour="#ff7452" title="Background color : Medium red 85%">gear_position=R?</td><td class="confluenceTd">gear_position=R</td><td class="confluenceTd">gear_position=R</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd">gear_position=R</td></tr><tr><td colspan="8" style="text-align: center;" class="confluenceTd">GPS. Heading -120 and within spotting_distance ~ 40</td></tr><tr><td rowspan="2" class="confluenceTd">Loading</td><td rowspan="2" class="confluenceTd">Truck is being loaded by the shovel.</td><td rowspan="2" class="confluenceTd"><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/CEA/Loading" rel="nofollow">Loading</a></td><td class="confluenceTd">payload_status=9</td><td class="confluenceTd">vehicle_status/payload_status=3</td><td class="confluenceTd">payload_status=1</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd">payload_status=1</td><td class="confluenceTd">payload_status=B</td><td class="highlight-#ff7452 confluenceTd" data-highlight-colour="#ff7452" title="Background color : Medium red 85%">LME_DIPPER?</td><td class="confluenceTd">dipper</td></tr><tr><td colspan="8" style="text-align: center;" class="confluenceTd">GPS. loading_distance ~ 20</td></tr><tr><td rowspan="2" class="confluenceTd">Hauling</td><td rowspan="2" class="confluenceTd">Truck is travelling loaded after being assigned to a dump.</td><td rowspan="2" class="confluenceTd"><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/CEA/Hauling" rel="nofollow">Hauling</a></td><td class="confluenceTd">payload_status=8</td><td class="confluenceTd">Final Payload</td><td class="confluenceTd">payload_status=9</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd">payload_status=4</td><td class="confluenceTd">payload_status=L</td><td class="highlight-#ff7452 confluenceTd" data-highlight-colour="#ff7452" title="Background color : Medium red 85%">LME_TONS?</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td></tr><tr><td colspan="8" style="text-align: center;" class="confluenceTd">GPS. departure_distance ~ 50</td></tr><tr><td class="confluenceTd">Queuing at dump</td><td class="confluenceTd">Truck is queued and waiting to tip at the dump.</td><td class="confluenceTd"><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/CEA/Queued+at+Dump" rel="nofollow">Queued+at+Dump</a></td><td colspan="8" style="text-align: center;" class="confluenceTd">GPS. stopped within dump boundary</td></tr><tr><td rowspan="2" class="confluenceTd">Backing</td><td rowspan="2" class="confluenceTd">Truck is positioning ready to dump.</td><td rowspan="2" class="confluenceTd"><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/CEA/Backing" rel="nofollow">Backing</a></td><td class="confluenceTd">gear_position=R</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="highlight-#ff7452 confluenceTd" data-highlight-colour="#ff7452" title="Background color : Medium red 85%">gear_position=R?</td><td class="confluenceTd">gear_position=R</td><td class="confluenceTd">gear_position=R</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd">gear_position=R</td></tr><tr><td colspan="8" style="text-align: center;" class="confluenceTd">GPS. Heading -120 </td></tr><tr><td rowspan="2" class="confluenceTd">Tipping</td><td rowspan="2" class="confluenceTd">Truck is emptying its load.</td><td rowspan="2" class="confluenceTd"><a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/CEA/Tipping" rel="nofollow">Tipping</a></td><td class="confluenceTd">payload_status=4</td><td class="confluenceTd">Tray Up (if trayup_tipping config enabled) or vehicle_status/payload_status=6</td><td class="confluenceTd">payload_status=7</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd">payload_status=5</td><td class="confluenceTd">payload_status=D</td><td class="highlight-#ff7452 confluenceTd" data-highlight-colour="#ff7452" title="Background color : Medium red 85%">LME_DUMP?</td><td class="confluenceTd">body_lever</td></tr><tr><td colspan="8" style="text-align: center;" class="confluenceTd">GPS. Stopped within tipping_distance ~ 50</td></tr></tbody></table></div></p>
	</div>
</div>

    </section>
</div>

                    </div>
    </li>
        <li>
        <div>
                <span class="icon aui-icon content-type-page" title="Página">Página:</span>        </div>

        <div class="details">
                        <a href="/display/MINH/Cylinder+Bypass">Cylinder Bypass</a>
                                         <span class="smalltext">(HxGN MineOperate Asset Health)</span>
             
                        
                    </div>
    </li>
        <li>
        <div>
                <span class="icon aui-icon content-type-page" title="Página">Página:</span>        </div>

        <div class="details">
                        <a href="/display/MINH/Boost+Balance">Boost Balance</a>
                                         <span class="smalltext">(HxGN MineOperate Asset Health)</span>
             
                        
                    </div>
    </li>

class="confluenceTh">Expected Result</th><th class="confluenceTh">Notes</th></tr><tr class=""><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd">Road condition icons</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="status-macro aui-lozenge aui-lozenge-error">FAILED</span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>Using the config specified <a href="https://confluence.hexagonmining.com/display/PE/Road+Conditions#RoadConditions-displayIcons">here</a>, the road condition icons don't appear on the equipment GPS map.</p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>The road condition should be seen on the map</p><p><br/></p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p><br/></p></td></tr><tr class=""><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd">Clearing Road Conditions</td><td class="confluenceTd"><br/></td><td class="confluenceTd"><div class="content-wrapper"><p><span class="status-macro aui-lozenge aui-lozenge-moved">REVIEW</span></p></div></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>The logic doesn't seem to take into account the exact location of the dusty road condition - the sprayer can be turned on momentarily, with the watertruck not even passing the location of the dusty road (with the sprayer on) - the road condition will still be cleared.</p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p>The watertruck should actually pass the location of the dusty road condition with the sprayer on for it to be cleared.</p><p><br/></p></td><td class="confluenceTd"><p><br/></p></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
</div>
</p></div></div>
